Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell1122
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Maryland every summer for about 25 years. Although I have stayed in many places the Francis Scott Key Family Resort is my favorite. We have three children spread out in age and there is plenty to do for everyone. The location is convenient for numerous daily adventures. My sons love the shuttle to the boardwalk and my daughter loves to take a ride to the Salisbury Zoo. We enjoy going into Berlin or maybe taking a ride after dinner to see the ponies. It's nice having the outlets right across the way too. Frontier Town is one of my daughters favorite places and my husband loves the Greene Turtle. Even if we just stay on the premises we always have a great time. The outdoor pool is great and the pirate slide area is so nice for small children. We also enjoy the indoor pool and snack area. We loved that you had food this year. Our experience has always been that the rooms are kept well and very clean. Anytime we've needed anything the front desk is always polite and helpful. We always look forward to coming back! Marie R.

Reviews.Title: “nice play to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: kevin h
Reviews.Content: My family took our first trip to OC in late August and after a long process of looking for a place to stay, we ended up here at FSK. All the positives, the indoor pool and bar, very nice and the hot tub for myself was a bonus. The little water slide is pretty cool as it's just enough for kids to enjoy. The outdoor pool area looked fine and the pirate ship was wonderful. The diner is a great place to eat, food is great and the staff are the same. Now the min goldf course is a nice set up however the greens are torn a bit which affects the ball at times. Definitely needs to be replaced but the layout of the course is good. My room in the Carolina building second floor was good. People could have issues with the beds. I loved the bed, my wife did not and had some back issues for a day but was quickly healed. The grounds look old which is i'm sure is part of the look but at times it could look a little outdated. Overall, very ni8ce place to stay. Needs the continued updates, but a great place to stay if they keep it up to par and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: guy241
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the weekend prior to July 4th and to say the least we were very disappointed. We have been at the FSK numerous times in the past and we understand what to expect. This time was so much different, for the first time we stayed in one of the "NEWLY REMOLDELED FOR 2012 RANCH ROOMS", if you call a coat of paint, and very old dirty fixtures newly remodeled, then you would be happy here. Upon arrival our room was musty, the door when closed had gaps all around it, numerous screw holes and two sided tape stuck all over, the room was just run down. Then we noticed ants crawling all over our dresser, tv and then on the nightstand. We called the front desk,within minutes someone arrived and sprayed ant killer all over the room. They moved the night stand and found an infinite number of ants under it eating candy that was laying there. They cleaned it up, and just in case left us the can of ant killer if we needed it again of which we needed it continuously. The room was also very noisy due to a construction project right outside our window that went on all weekend. The bathroom had a little pedestal sink, no counter space, no where to put anything and it was very small, I had to go outside to change my mind. The sink and shower had old worn out faucets and a couple of ants too. As for the beds, I do not know what size they are, but they sure are small and close together. Like I said we stayed here in the past and understand that it is a old property, that is out of date, and not very fancy, but this was way beyond that. We will not stay here again, no need to put up with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Maria J
Reviews.Content: We usually travel here the last weeks of August for a great value. We have been to the resort 3 times and have always had a wonderful experience. The free shuttle to the beach and boardwalk every 15 mins is a 7 min ride! The pirate ship spray ground is great. The indoor pool area has saved us from unexpected rainstorms several times. The new renovations ...... well now the beds are just too comfy to leave. The retro 50s diner is right on. Movie room for groups to watch movies every night. Internet room/reading room. You can order pizza from the bar at the indoor pool. The outdoor pool has a bar... remember it is your vacation too. Free mini golf, playground. Free family DVDs for your room avail at the front desk. Outlet Shopping directly across the street. The best location for our Ocean City MD vacations. Close proximity to everything and yet you don't really need to leave the resort just relax.

Reviews.Title: “"Resort"? Definitely just a motel. Average; nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Brandi S
Reviews.Content: We chose the Francis Scott Key Family Resort for our 4-day Labor Day weekend stay because of its high rating (#10) on Trip Advisor among hotels in Ocean City, MD. This was definitely not what we had expected, based on what its website boasts and how highly it was rated on Trip Advisor. We selected a family size suite in one of the "Ranch" buildings at the "resort", because our daughter is handicapped and these were the buildings that FSK described as "accessible". Getting in and out of the room was fine; definitely accessible for those in wheelchairs. The room was NOT what we had expected... 2 full size beds, about 2ft away from each other, and not much space in the room. There's a sleeper sofa also. We never opened it, because I can't imagine how a family could have that open and still have room to walk. There was a nice sized refrigerator in the room, which was a definite plus. The TV was old and fuzzy; the cable was not reliable. There was a DVD player built into the TV, which was a life saver considering the cable was fritzy and barely visible. The bathroom was pretty small for a handicapped accessible bathroom. While there were plenty of safety bars to grab onto, there were no floor treads in the tub and both of our kids slipped multiple times while trying to shower. The shower head was tiny and the water pressure was not so great at all. We were definitely disappointed in the size of the bathroom and the size of the room. For the rate that we paid, we had expected a "suite" as it was described. A loud AC unit that gave our entire family sore throats and allergies, a tiny table with two chairs, and a musty room were not our idea of a "suite". I'm not sure why they call this place a "resort". They talk about their indoor and outdoor water parks on their website, as well as their mini golf. I think people should know what these attractions are REALLY like... The pirate "sprayground" was AWESOME. The kids loved it. It had multiple water slides, and all sorts of water attractions like a mushroom and dumping buckets of water. There was a giant pirate ship that the kids could play on and enjoy. This is by far the best, and probably only, attraction of the resort. Everything else, I could've done without. The outdoor pool is just that: a measley pool, that didn't look too inviting. No water slides. No activities for the kids to do by the pool or in the pool. Just an in ground pool with some pool chairs. The mini golf was lousy. It was 18 holes packed into a tiny space, and it was lackluster. The area definitely needs some attention. We all found it to be very boring and mundane. We should have paid the money to go play some exciting mini golf on Coastal Highway. The indoor "water park" was a pool with one small water slide about the size of a swing set slide, a hot tub attached, and a few small features within the pool. We were expecting an indoor water park, with many slides. This was a disappointment, for sure. This place is far too expensive for what they offer. It needs many, many upgrades. If you still intend on staying there, don't expect they will vacuum your room. Housekeeping basically comes in, makes the bed with your dirty sheets, replaces your dirty towels with clean ones, and leaves. They didn't vacuum once, clean the toilet or sink or shower/tub, or anything else. I was really disappointed with this also. This is not the type of service we had expected. For almost $700 for 4 nights, we will never stay here again. And we will absolutely not recommend this place to anyone else. It's a waste of money. You're better off paying the same amount to stay on the boardwalk and just enjoy the beach. This is a tiny step up from a motel, and we couldn't wait to leave this grimy place.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom line: your kids will love it”
Reviews.Author: Dewey2cats
Reviews.Content: This place isn't designed to please a those looking for luxury, updated furniture, or trendy. It knows it purpose is to keep the parents happy by wearing out the kids with all the fun they can handle. And they are very good at that. They please the parents with very good customer service and a large clean room. Every kid there was smiling, because the spray ground was huge and well designed, as well as the indoor pool which is more playground than pool. You can't stay at the beach all day, and with this hotel you might actually forget there's a beach only 1 mile away.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: hilarya93
Reviews.Content: My family decided to go somewhere we had never been before for our family vacation. We decided on Ocean City, MD. I was looking online at ratings for hotels and resorts and I stumbled upon an ad for Francis Scott Key Family Resort. I have a toddler and a teenager, and to find somewhere for them to stay and have a good time is a hard task! This resort has something for everyone, from the indoor pool to the outdoor pool, the arcade and the putt putt course. They are in a great area, not too far from the beach and they even offer a free shuttle ride to the beach constantly throughout the daytime. I had no complaints and won't hesitate to stay there when we go back. We even left our daughters brand new baby doll, and once I contacted Lisa, the housekeeping supervisor, she offered to mail it to me for a minimal fee. My daughter was very happy to see her baby doll three days later. Thanks for a great stay FSKFR.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, convenient place for family...”
Reviews.Author: Venus222
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Francis Scott Resort 5 days. I had a good time! Check-in was pretty fast, front desk person very informative. Sorry, I can't remember her name. Anyway, I stayed in a room that hadn't been updated with a flat screen & blah blah.. But it was okay. The room was clean, not sparkling but clean. (I noticed a few ants) However, there are several things to do on the resort and surrounding! I was surprised & pleased. My kids loved it & asked to go back! Oh, maintenance was superb... Locked my keys in my car & they out in 5 minutes! Toilet was clogged, unclogged in 5 minutes! Thank you....

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: jcs2100
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Francis Scott Key. We stayed in an efficiency with a full kitchen. The room was very clean and comfortable. We were supplied with more towels than any other hotel we stayed in. I like the spacious grounds. Plenty of parking. Great activities are all included in the price of the room. We found the staff to be friendly, efficient and always ready to help. Our TV didn't come on and maintenance was there in minutes and took care of the problem. There was also a follow up call to be sure the problem was solved. Check in and out was fast and easy. We were in the Florida building at the back of the property. It was peaceful and quiet. We like to visit Assateaque State and National parks. The location couldn't be better. It's a quick drive to beautiful beaches and wonderful wildlife. Next year we are planning on staying with our children and grandchildren. They will love the pirate ship and indoor splash pool. Very safe and secure site.I found the price to be very reasonable for the amenities included. The onsite restautant has been recently renovated in the origional 50's theme. It was a fun place to visit with a great staff. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay with Kids!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ravnchic55
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at the resort!!!! My daughter was in her glory the whole weekend!!!! The Indoor Pool and Pirate Ship were a big hit. We got to use the pools before we even got our room and they let us use the pools and showers up until 6pm after we checked out!!!! The only disapointing thing was the Diner took forever to get our breakfeast. other then that It was an amazing stay and will recommend to friends and family!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Family Oriented Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tina W
Reviews.Content: A few years ago my Mom took my Daughter to Ocean City, MD and they were looking for a place to stay and came across Francis Scott Key Resort. They raved about how nice the place was and all the things to do at the one location. My Husband, Daughter and I have since stayed at the Francis Scott Key Resort...it has been our only selection for our Ocean City trips/vacation. We like the family oriented resort with many things to do on-site and the clean rooms/pools, etc. The staff as well as the waitress' at the diner are always friendly and willing to assist. We highly recommend this resort for any time of the year....and definitely plan on going back again next Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place & great value”
Reviews.Author: Dotty B
Reviews.Content: We found the room very clean & roomy. It was a wonderful first time experience for us at this resort. We took our 3 grandkids with us (ages 3,7 & 9) & they absolutely loved it. We only had a short stay since school was starting soon but definitely wished we would have stayed longer! We hope to come back next summer & benefit from all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness not top priority”
Reviews.Author: JulieLindsay
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was bittersweet. Amazing pool, spray ground pirate ship and shuttle. That was the sweet part of out stay. The room which was in the lodge was bitter. Our first and only complaint to the front desk was about the horrible mold smell in our room and what appeared to be throw up outside our room. They did make note of it and during one of our treks to the room with luggage there was a maid sitting next to it spraying what appeared to be water on it. Then she left never to return. The floor was never cleaned up so we avoided the area at all cost. After seeing that and realizing the maid staff doesn't care about cleanliness - I am guessing because there is no one following up on them- we did not complain about how filthy the bathroom was. There was buildup around the faucet that went into the sink every time it got wet. The shower tiles need to be tilexed desperately. And we found a fork under the table...hmmmm what else do they ignore then. For a family on a very tight budget this was a disappointing stay. I wish I could say the 3 amenities we did enjoy made up for it but it didn't come close. I think management and owners need to find a better way to ensure cleaning is being done properly.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite spot! We come back every year”
Reviews.Author: Kmac1414
Reviews.Content: There is so much to do! Right on the resort! We go the same time as my mom and grandmother, aunts and cousins. This year there were 9 of us ages 4 to 80 and we all had a blast! My daughter, 4, loves the spray ground and indoor pool. I love the putt putt being right out front:-) We all love the shuttle right to the board walk, the friendly staff, and the week always flies by!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!! NO CONCEPT OF CUSTOMER SERVICE....TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Alas2012
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay after all the great reviews, but were SOOOO disappointed with our stay. Arrived at check in time (3pm) and went to get something to eat at the 50's diner, but they close at 3?? Interesting welcome, but not a big deal. Dropped luggage off and went into town for evening. Came back late, we were literally in the room 10 minutes when the power and water went out. Went to front office to check out the situation as our 5 yr old daughter was scared to death of the pitch black. Manager on duty Ben [--] could care less about our situation. (No shower, no air conditioning and a screaming 5 yr old). I get that the power going out was not their fault but he was rude and told us if we were unhappy, we could check out. The power finally came on an hour and a half later. Went to front office in morning to talk to manager/owner, and the General Manager was there, but declined to speak with me. Per front desk rep, wanted to send me on my way with a 10% off on our next stay, like we wanted to come back. I would have just been happy to have someone speak to me without being rude or blowing me off! Probably fine place if nothing out of ordinary happens, just know if anything goes wrong, you will not be taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Beamer4888
Reviews.Content: I'm a special case. My job makes planning over-nights in resort towns, 'problematic'. No matter how detailed or demanding I might get, however, Becky was able to manage my reservation with professionalism and a smile. (I won't bother explaining what I put her through, but suffice it to say most people would have contacted their voodoo priestess for a doll...) My group is comprised of serious fishermen who enjoy being not-so-serious at times. We all have nicknames and when Anne asked me to 'name' the occupants of the second room I had reserved, I, of course, included the nicknames. Upon their arrival, they were greeted using those monikers and that set the tone for the rest of the stay. Fishing being our prime objective, the resort is adjacent to the Ocean City Fishing Center and very nearby the Sunset Marina. Both have a rock-solid charter fleet, ship's store and restaurant. There are tons of other eating and drinking establishments close by as well. If you choose to cross the bridge and go into OC proper, it is just a minute or two to the beach, boardwalk and the multitude of shops. Rooms are clean and reasonable and the staff is exceptional. The only issue I had was the internet infrastructure is not robust enough to manage all the traffic. We simply could not get online during normal hours. For some of us, that is a blessing. Highly recommend these good folks and their resort! Sandy Green AKA 'Beamer'

Reviews.Title: “Recommended--but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you have very young children and plan to hang around the premises for a lot of your entertainment. There's a nice pool playground for the little ones, and they also offer kiddie movies, art lessons, and various contests. If you want to leave, the beach shuttle was very reliable and ran in a continuous loop with very little wait. If you have OCD or fancy yourself to be the hotel inspector, you would not like this place. It is clean--in fact the maid service was better than in a lot of fancy places I've stayed in--but there's a lot of chipping paint, holes in the caulk, etc. The more negative reviews are, unfortunately, pretty accurate about that kind of thing. Would I recommend this hotel? Definitely to families with young children, but not to adults looking for a quiet, luxurious or romantic resort.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time at FSK - and many more to come.”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Francis Scott Key and they keep getting better and better. The staff at FSK could not have been any nicer, from the pleasant housekeeping staff to the shuttle bus drivers and it's these people who make this a truly great resort. Our 3 year old twins had a blast at the sprayground and my older 6 year old son had fun swimming at the outdoor pool. We went fishing at the pond located on the property, and he caught his first fish. We also loved the new concession stand inside the indoor pool area. We love the fact that we know what we are getting when we book this hotel. They truly seem to care for their guests and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “SURPASS ALL EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: bjsc g
Reviews.Content: We stayed af FSK for five days July 23-27, 2012, and it was one of the best vacations we ever had. We plan on going next year for at least 7 days.. We took our 6 year old daughter and my 80 year old mother. We stayed in room 502 because of mothers handicap, and I can't say enough wonderful things about our experience there. First of all having our daughter and mother along I really needed the room to be extra clean, and it was. The litle girl house keeper did a superior job and that means alot for family travel. The 50's signature Diner was so great, from the theme decorations, clasic car check out, the music, the sceens at every booth, the entire feel of friendlyness from the 50's was a delight. The food was sooooooo good and the price was great. We ate there once every day. Now getting to the facility things to do......amazing! Our daughter loved the splash pirate ship, the indoor pool, outdoor pool and even the tiny pool was great. Everything was so clean and the staff was amazing, all smiles and friendly. We all enjoyed the minature golf, and the family movie night with free popcorn was a great touch, a family movie every night. We loved it, while our little one played in the out side pool we took advantage of the friendly service at the pool bar and ate lunch there a few times. The drinks of the day were yummy! Even the other families seemed to be so friendly, our little girl made a few good friends, they intend to keep in touch. The entire staff was outstanding, but I have to mention a couple by name, Casey, Ann, Ben and maint. man Tim. These guys went above and beyond to make our stay special. All in all we can't wait to go back. Thank you for such great memories for summer 2012. The Gallagher Family ps. we really appreciated the shuttle to the beach, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “First Time There”
Reviews.Author: Latonya W
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Ocean City MD. and to The Francis Scoot Key Resort and all I have to say is that I'll be back.. The resort was wonderful and the rooms are delightful ,every time housekeeping came and change the sheets they would leave a towel made out of a different animals everyday and the kids thought that this was so cool.. The indoor pool area was relief from the rain on the days that it rain and they weren't crowded at all. With fast foods places right near the resort and it save us alot of money on food and the shuttle services to the beach was great too. Disney World is usually our family trip time but Francis Scott Key has now taking their place..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Leesa T
Reviews.Content: We just concluded our 1st vacation with 3 generations of family all staying at your resort. It was absolutely fabulous! From 14 month old twins to 57 yr old grandpa's there was something for everyone! The accomodations were perfect. We were able to vacation with my son and his 3 children and my daughter and her three children, and still enjoy our own space too. The shuttle was a blessing, and also the discounted tickets to Jolly Rogers! We can't wait to make our reservations for next year! Thank you for creating such a wonderful place for all age groups to vacation together and relax and enjoy! I loved the Temperpedic mattresses!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Ocean City!!”
Reviews.Author: Saraxo8
Reviews.Content: This place s trly a hidden gem in OC!! It all started five or six years ago when my mom, and grandmother and myself decided to go to oc,md.Our first trp, The last week of august, so no surprise that all beach front hotels were full. My mother said she really wanted to stay on the beach front, but since we had no choice we crossed the bridge, and what we found ended up to be so good we have gone back every summer. The Francis Scott Key Resort has almost everything there for a family. We were very satisfied with the shuttle services to and from the beach, and they were very nice about finding us a bottom level floor for my grandmother. They have two pools and a splash pirate ship. But they also have several games and activities planned for kids, such as savenger hunts, bingo, boat building, golf tournaments and mch more! Also if its ever raining and you find yourself with nothng to do, right across the street re stores and outlets. i highly suggest staying here, it is doing alot of work to become modern. Everyone has a great time there and its not too expensive either!

Reviews.Title: “The extras are great... the room, not so great...”
Reviews.Author: RavensFan
Reviews.Content: Just finished a decent stay there (our first). The pools... good / great for kids. The pirate ship themed splash zone... great for kids. Mini-golf and playground on the premises... great for kids. Beach volleyball court... nice addition. Free DVD rentals for a pre-bed kid movie in the room... nice perk. The occasional kid-themed activities and nightly movie... nice perk. The shuttle to the boardwalk, while we never used it... nice perk to have available. Good breakfasts at the on-site small diner. Quick walk to Starbucks, grocery stores nearby, all good things. Lunches at the nearby Shrimp Boat and Smokers BBQ Pit were excellent, if you like shrimp and/or BBQ. Cuts the commute to Assateague down a bit as well, where we spent all of our "beach time". The price seemed reasonable as well given the time of year and the perks mentioned above. All positives! The only disappointment was the room itself. Clean, I think so. Nothing notable that alarmed us. But it was definitely dated (even though it was touted as "newly renovated" or something along those lines when the reservation was made). The bathroom could use an overhaul and fresh paint. The paneling on the walls gave me visions of a 70s or 80s version of "man cave". :) There was a "peeler"-like utensil in the mini-kitchen that was rusty. Saw more than a handful of ants all over the room at various times, including high up the walls and on the refrigerator. And "quiet" wasn't exactly easy to come by at times... one night we could hear every word of prolonged parent / child arguments in adjacent rooms while also hearing the footsteps of people above us. In fairness, our neighbors probably had to deal with our voices anytime we raised them above a normal tone. The tub drained very slowly from day one. All in all, it was certainly more "favorable" than not... but I can't help thinking that it wouldn't get an even bigger boost in reputation if they brightened the walls, updated the carpet, painted the bathrooms and updated the tub / shower stall.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: grapplergrl
Reviews.Content: FSK is a wonderful resort for children and adults! They really take care of you there! Very nice and accomodating! They have three pools and a shady woodsy area if you just want to relax and take a break from the hot sun. And if your in the mood you can grill or lite their outdoor fireplace! The shuttles take you to and from the beach all day. Free movie rentals and movie nights! 14 Acres for toddlers to run..playground and mini golf. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend Getaway to the FSK”
Reviews.Author: jdwv
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend in the Pennsylvania building. This is our second year staying at the FSK and we always enjoy ourselves! The pool areas were very clean. The rooms were clean, the Tempurpedic mattresses are very comfortable and the air conditioning worked great! The shuttle service into Ocean City is great as well. I love having Starbucks right next door too. Great place for the price! We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT STAY GREAT PROPERTY AND VERY NICE PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: alexgon3
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from this place this evening and had a great time we were a family of over 60 people and the facility's were awesome the splash park was great my son loved it and indoor/outdoor pool were great also we used the grills to have a BBQ and volleyball courts everything u could think about to make your time great, the only complain I have was when I got the room it had a musty/moldy smell but after a phone call they sent some little machine and it smelled a lil better but we totally forgot about it with all the enjoyment we were having A+++++++ to the facility. We will be back here very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Come with Kids!”
Reviews.Author: SaraBMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over a weekend with our 4 year old. 2 nights was definately not enough time - there were so many things to do just at the hotel! My son LOVED the pirate ship splash park and the shuttle to/from the beach was great and convenient. We're already planning to visit again soon! The room was cozy and having a fridge and table to eat at were a big help! The service was great. Soon after we got to our room, housekeeping called to make sure everything was ok and we didn't need anything.

Reviews.Title: “"Will go only to FSK when staying in OC MD!"”
Reviews.Author: kennymacda
Reviews.Content: For our 12th year in a row, again, FSK is the place to go. Every year they add something else along the way to make your time while staying there more enjoyable. From the time we arrived to the time we departed, everyone was more then helpful along the way.

Reviews.Title: “We'll keep coming back....”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Lovington
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th summer at FSK and we will continue to come back year after year. We love Ocean City, but we keep coming back because of FSK. It's so easy to enjoy yourself at FSK because everything is so easy. There are plenty of activities for the family from the indoor pool, outdoor pool, sprayground, mini golf, free movies, and activities for the kids. My kids love it, they are 4 1/2 and almost 3 and we have been coming since my younger one wasn't even born yet! The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. There is a diner by the front lobby which is nice and they have a free shuttle service to the beach/boardwalk. We just used the shuttle this year for the first time and my kids loved it, thought it was so fun to ride the "bus". We also like the new editions this year like the indoor pool now has a snack bar which is great for a little something and the laundry room now is 24 hours which comes in handy on a week long trip. We are just so happy to make FSK our family's favorite place to go in the summer and a true summer tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time at FSK!”
Reviews.Author: SweetP66
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this resort & we loved it!. Beautiful property, friendly/helpful staff. We stayed in the Ohio bldg which was perfect because we were in the middle of all the amentities (indoor pool behind us, basketball, pirarte spray pool & putt putt in front of us)There were so many activities for the kids to do at the resort we didn't even visit the boardwalk for 2 days. The room was very spacious (we also had a full kitchen) & the cleaning service always left a animal shaped towel on the bed for the kids.The pools were fun & spacious. The kids also enjoyed the 50s style Diner..the food was so good & reasonably priced. The resort has shuttles that took you over to the boardwalk (only 5min drive) which was great because I didn't want to have to worry about parking. Overall this is the best resort I've been to in MD & can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Take ya family!!”
Reviews.Author: JiggaJune
Reviews.Content: Everything at the FSK was very good. Its the perfect spot for a family vacation at the beach. So much to do for the kids that goin the beach will become the secondary plan for the stay. The rooms are a lil ol'fashioned and motel styled, but it creates an excellent family atmosphere. I'm goin back in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for kids!”
Reviews.Author: lovesgetaways32
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this resort. We booked a Ranch room online and right before we left I got an email saying that we were staying in the Pennsylvania building and owed $33 more at check in (when everything was paid in full months ago). So when I called and said this was not right the guy at the front desk just said that he did not know what to tell me and that I should just cancel my room. He let me speak to a manager and Becky the front desk manager came to the rescue, she was very friendly and Professional (you don't find that too often any more). She said that they honestly overbooked the ranch rooms and moved us to the Pennsylvania building and that she would remove the $33 that we should not have to pay the extra since they were the ones that moved us. The only thing about the room that I found I did not like was there were chips in one of the beds so they must not have changed the sheets. The kids did enjoy the indoor pool as usual and they put in a new snack and drink desk which was nice. The next day they enjoyed the putt golf and fishing. My 8 and 9 year old are too big for the pirate ship pool now which they did not seem to mind. We had breakfast at the 50's diner, which we always do, and it was nice. The kids like to play the old time cartoons on a little tv screen at the table. I hope to be able to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, but!”
Reviews.Author: emptymind2k7
Reviews.Content: Okay 1st I would like to say that I loved this place. It's just in the right location. close to the beach, shopping, fishing, eating, everything. This place for the price is awesome. So much to do on the property with the kids didn't have time to do what we went to Ocean City for. hahaha. We had breakfast at the on location restaurant it was great. The shuttle bus to and from the beach was great. putt putt was fun. two swimming pools great and the pirates ship was great for the kids and for us could lay in the sun for that great Ocean city tan we love to get. If you have a family I would say come and stay here your kids will love it and so will you. Now for the bad. We stayed at the newly remodeled part of the resort. Looks like they could have spend more time in the care of how they did it. paneling is installed poorly at best. Air conditioner did not cool and was very loud ( they did come and change it which this one worked great) but did a bad job putting the foam around the unit so it made it very easy for the flies to enjoy the cool air too. The towel rack fell off in the bathroom so they has to come replace that. We did not like the beds temper pedic mattress can't move after you fall asleep. The bathrooms need counter space I mean there is no counter space just a toilet, bathtub and pedestal sink that is it. A shelf would of been fine. sucks to have to leave the bathroom to get toothpaste, brush ect. But I do not go to Ocean City to stay indoors. But that being said I would love to stay there again and we will next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen T
Reviews.Content: Our family had our family reunion at the Francis Scott Key Family Resort July 13-15, 2012. We had a great time. The facility is clean and well managed. The front desk staff was pleasant. Great place for families to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JenDoran
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with our 5 year old daughter and had a blast. They have so much for kids to do. The pool and spray park are great. My husband and I were very impressed with the rooms. Very clean and pleasant. The memory foam mattresses were so comfortable! Staff was very friendly. Most important, I found the rate to be pretty agreeable given that it is the height of tourist season. (We stayed in mid-July). Oh, and the free shuttle to the OC boardwalk was also a great perk! We will most definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “FSK Perfect Base for OC Family Vaca”
Reviews.Author: lalafreda
Reviews.Content: We liked: - clean, updated rooms - quick shuttle to boardwalk/beach - kids kept active with included baby/outdoor pools, mini golf, playground, pirate splashground, indoor multi-featured and shaded pool - grilling at the picnic pavilion, kids playing by the pond, grassy area for soccer - pool bars indoors and outside, fun drinks, accommodating bartenders - free park ranger-led clamming and crabbing programs on Assateague Island (less than 15 minutes away) - Crab Alley right around the corner, locally sourced seafood, great service - J&J's Pizzeria up the road for carryout - delicious even by an Italian New Yorker family's standards We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Another FSK fan!”
Reviews.Author: baxterstravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at FSK. We were traveling with our two young sons, ages 2.5 and 1. The hotel is exactly what reviewers here say. The room is tidy and a nice size, but it isn't fancy. The property has tons of activities for lil ones. The indoor pool is fun- we never found it too crowded or unruly. My son could've spent all day on the water slide. The pirate ship sprayground was great too. There was also an outdoor pool, which we didn't use because the other ones were so much fun for our kids. We played mini golf. The staff were pleasant and accomodating. We had a broken fridge in our room on the first night, but we had a brand new one after one call and ten minutes. We would love to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Francis Scott Key is a GREAT place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: CMT5
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Francis Scott Key for over 20 years and it just keeps getting better. This is a very clean, safe and family friendly place to stay. There are things to do for all ages. The staff is always very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean. We love the FSK and all the amenities it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Third year in a row and still like it”
Reviews.Author: RacerDad0
Reviews.Content: Something for everyone, and a great place for the kids! This was our third year at the resort, and we still had fun! They try very hard to give you a nice and relaxing vacation, and they do a great job. I would recommend FSK to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed every summer the past 4 years”
Reviews.Author: lwirth76
Reviews.Content: We have been to the FSK Motel at least 4 times. 3 of the 4 times were amazing, friendly staff wonderful rooms that are clean and bright. This time I would say our stay was "eh". There was something off about the clientele. Every other time we stayed you would walk through the grounds and everyone said hello and good morning this time the other guests were just not friendly. My 7 year old is getting too big for the pirate ship so wanted to be in the indoor pool a lot. My only way to describe it this time was Chaos. The life guards looked really over whelmed and again the guests were just not nice. This is our first not perfect experience so we will likely give it another try (and frankly I can't blame them for the clientele). The pirate ship spray ground remains a highlight (my 3 year old loves it). The shuttle is great and the bus drivers were always fantastic. The bartender at the outdoor pool shack (a guy can't remember his name) is totally not nice. The girls that clean the rooms are always wonderful and leave these cute towel animals for the kids. So long story short - there are definitely some pluses and minuses.... The biggest draw back for me this trip was the indoor pool being totally out of control (are they selling day passes now??) and the other guests which were just not as friendly as we have experienced in the past.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoy the FSK.”
Reviews.Author: Tarristrvlr
Reviews.Content: My family and I have traveled to this quaint hotel a number of times. We often go in the winter to take a break from the cold. They have a really cute Carribean-themed indoor pool so it's a nice mid-winter get-away. We just went for a summer weekend get-away this past weekend and enjoyed it even more. There are a number of things for children to do. My guys went from the indoor pool, to the outdoor pool, to putt-putt, to the pirate ship all day long. That left my husband and I to have some quiet time at the outdoor pool! All of the employees we interacted with were great. Colleen the outdoor pool bartender was really friendly and helped us remember the name of a place we wanted to try for lunch. The young man at the putt-putt stand was adorable...even in 104 degree heat! I can't recommend this place enough...it's just a sweet, family-style motel, that has a real "yester-year" feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Most kid-friendly hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: mallprincess807
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we've stayed at the Francis Scott Key. My 5 yr old daughter absolutely loves it! There are so many things to do in Ocean City, but she would be perfectly content spending the whole vacation at the hotel. The indoor pool is awesome! The pirate sprayground is super cool too! There are so many amenties, you could spend a day or two at the hotel enjoying everything! Five stars for the Francis Scott Key!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Robin D
Reviews.Content: Everything is there you could ask for, I would maybe recommend an hr extension at night for pool and activities, but other then that, everything was great. perfect stay for the family and if you like going to the beach, hop on shuttle, drops you off less then a block on somerset from boardwalk, cant beat that or if you just want that get away, the kids have alot to do, and poolside is awesome. already tried to book for next year but have to wait til October. this was our second year of staying here... stayed Sunday til Friday and the entire trip, not a rude person was met that worked there.

Reviews.Title: “The grandkids love it...”
Reviews.Author: Pegaroo_12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for the last two years and again this year in Aug. We stay on Thurs and Fri and then move to our Condo in OC for the rest of the week. We look forward to it every year. We are treated very well, pools are clean, rooms are clean. Kids love to play the little golf course and fish. It is a great two days stay. It might not be the Hilton, and if that is what you are looking for, then by all means stay at the Hilton, but the kids won't have as much fun...

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: dcp1100
Reviews.Content: The room smelled and had ants in it. The employees at the front desk are very rude and not helpful. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids just okay for parents”
Reviews.Author: teka2012
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from staying at FSK for the first time (week of July 2nd, 2012) and while my kids absolutely loved the amenities my husband are conflicted as to if we should stay here again next year because of the room noise/thin walls. See below. Pros: Indoor pool Splash park Friendly staff (the lifegaurds there are really great) 50s diner has FREE donuts :) Kids activities Clean rooms Cons: Small beds Thin walls (you can hear everything) We stayed in an upgraded room w/ kitchenette (New York) on the first floor and me and my husband could barely sleep because of the loud stomping above us. It would have been nice for things to be quieter (or even if quiet hours would start at 10pm instead of 11pm). There was also a really loud creaking sound that would follow for 30 seconds after the people above us would run the water or flush the toilet. I think there was an issue with the pipes. On Friday, the power went out in our building for about 8 hours at night and while the front desk was friendly they didn't have many details on what occured or how long the outage would last. We have two boys aged 7 and 2 and were worried when the temperature started to rise in the room. The rooms were very clean just smaller than what we are used to. That being said It was not all bad. Since we were on vacation we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room. What I will say is that I really appreciated the nice staff and all of the wonderful activities they have for children. My children loved all the water activities- they even had an indoor pool word search. It really saves money because we didn't need to pay to go to a waterpark this year as the kids just wanted to stay at FSK the entire time. Plus there is free fishing with rods and bait provided. Me and my husband also met some other families while playing volleyball in the pool. If anything we may try to book really early to stay in a cabin or second level room at FSK or opt for a closer location to the beach if all of the cabins are full next year. I was going to give three stars but had to upgrade my review to four stars because of all the amenties for children.

Reviews.Title: “6 days and counting!”
Reviews.Author: momnanny
Reviews.Content: 6 more days until we leave for our family vacation at FSK. My husband and I have been coming to FSK for quite a few years but have been coming for a long weekend with our 2 sons, 1 daughter, their spouses and grandchildren for the past 4 years. Everyone looks forward to our time there and hate leaving. There is so much for all of us to do and I love being a kid again when I am there. Yes, the pirate ship is more for younger kids, but I love it as much as the kids do! Mini golf, fishing, the pools, movie night, great breakfast at the diner...oh how I hope our time goes at a snail pace! Every time I talk to someone about Ocean City, I recommend FSK. Yes it's an older hotel but it's always been clean and the staff is always wonderful and you can tell the owners honestly care about their guests having a great vacation. There is not a hotel in Ocean City that offers half of the amenities that FSK offers. If you are considering a stay at FSK, don't hesitate. Take the negative comments with a grain of salt and enjoy yourself like we do. Or you can go stay at the Hilton and spend over $500 a night and get what?....a fancy room? Well, if you spend all of you're vacation in your room you might as well stay home and save yourself lots of money. As for me, I will be in count down mode until 5 a.m. Saturday. FSK here we come!

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the Pennsylvania building for a weekend and we had a great time. Yes, the rooms are dated, but who cares, they are clean. My son loved the Pirate Ship and the indoor pool. We had a great time, and all I can say is THANKS!!! We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Francis Scott Key family resort in Ocean City, Maryland. Overall our experience was great. There are alot of activities to do on-site and the shuttle service was outstanding. Our only down side was that there were ants in our room on our very first night of stay. As soon as the front desk was advised of the problem, they immediately corrected the problem by giving us ant spray and that worked. The Route 50 diner was nice but it would be nice if the resort could come up with a package that possibly includes meals.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLaura459
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cheap and it was very clean nice place to stay if your looking for something reasonable for a couple nights

Reviews.Title: “Our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: Our family stays at FSK every year and we love it!! The staff and front desk accomidated our every need while there and its the best value for your money so close to Ocean City. Our whole family is in a pic on your website (the one in the quad pool the day they built the cardboard boats) and my 9yr. old now thinks he is famous. LOL. We will continue to stay with FSK every summer, its our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “been here about 5 times now”
Reviews.Author: linbry2
Reviews.Content: this a is great place for families, clean, nice pool. and close to the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Returning this year...”
Reviews.Author: Melissa H
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was in June 2007, two of my children are featured on your website in the Sprayground banner picture on the Pirate Ship slides under amenities :). The kids had a blast and I enjoyed my stay as well. We always stay in one of the rooms with a full kitchen, which saves on the cost of going out to eat for all meals and located across from a shopping plaza with a decently priced grocery store. We returned in June 2009 and had a great experience as well. Now that the kids are older, we are coming back this July 2012. I'm looking forward to seeing all the upgrades and improvements as well as the new 50's diner and the kids are looking forward to the fun. The location is very convenient and the kids love both pools, playground, mini-golf and easy access to the beach and boardwalk. Can't wait to arrive in 4 weeks! ~Melissa, PA

Reviews.Title: “First Visit”
Reviews.Author: Wendy F
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at FSK, and overall it was a very nice experience. The rooms were clean, the staff was very pleasant, the amenities were amazing! As for the management, Anne Marie... was a life saver! I had left a very important UPS package (payroll) at the front desk. The FSK staff made a mistake and the package was not picked-up. I called Anne Marie as soon as I realized that it had not been delivered and she personally took the package to UPS for me. Thank you Anne Marie! I was able to make payroll on time! Wendy Friedman Prudential PenFed Realty

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value for Families”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaKK
Reviews.Content: This resort offers it all. It is a complete family environment with family friendly amenities and fantastic customer service. My family of 6 stayed at FSK 4/6-4/10. We were booked in the PA building which turned out to be ideal for us as it faced the quad containing the basketball court, laundry facilities, and small playground. I could attend to my infant in our room while viewing my older children (10,9, and 6) through the window. It was nice being close to the laundry room too. The laundry building was small but was clean and met our needs. I can imagine that it might not have enough washer/dryer units available during summer. Our room itself (2dbls w/pullout sofa)was just large enough not to feel like sardines while we settled in for the night. It was a clean, no frills room. The room was not updated but I did not reduce my rating based on the fact that the resort is in process of updating and without an updated room it is still a great value. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather during out time in Ocean City but it was great knowing we could use the indoor pool as a fall back. For my children, the absolute best part of our vacation was the indoor pool. They wanted to swim everyday all day. I was impressed by the size of the pool. More so, I was impressed that goggles,beach balls, life jackets, and towels were all provided on site. We did not take advantage of the free movie or on site mini golf. The outdoor pool, pirate ship, and diner were not yet open for the season. Still, we felt we got more than our money's worth at FSK. If we find ourselves back in Ocean City, FSK will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Kids love it”
Reviews.Author: Mzborrero
Reviews.Content: I have been going here with my family since 2010 I will say my kids love the indoor pool especially nice when it's not so much great weather for the beach he splash ground outside my kids enjoyed too every time we ever stayed there the rooms were clean never had issues with that also the pool area was always clean I did only have one issue back on 2010 when we vacationed there it was our first time my water had. Broken and we had no idea what hospital or where anything was we had the frot desk call 911 u think they'd come. Check on us but all I remember was a housekeeper seeing if I was okay but we still always went back and I AlWAYS recommend to my friends to Check This place out def ideal if yu Hav young children !

Reviews.Title: “Went for a childhood birthday party”
Reviews.Author: M_Robertson1027
Reviews.Content: I went here with a couple of friends and it was fantastic. The indoor pool with fun slides and water-volleyball was entertaining. It is in a good area and has a very comforting feeling. The cost was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to give a better review...”
Reviews.Author: Amy D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Spring of 2011 and again April 27th and 28th of this year. My children love this place, I just wish that I could. We were okay with it in 2011 but thought it a little dirty. This year didn't go as well. I held off my review for a couple of weeks because I thought the hotel might contact me over the survey I filled out including all my information. That isn't happening so here goes. The rooms have paper thin walls, that is true and in several reviews I read. The problem is also that the stairs are wooden and so is the deck outside the rooms. The sound is LOUD when someone walks by. My son was sleeping in the sleep chair in front of the window and was woken up several times. We knew this problem from last year so we brought a sound machine to try to mask the noise. It didn't help. That sound of clomping on the wood just cuts through everything. The rooms are large enough, and like I said ours had a chair that folded out into a single bed. Great for kids that don't want to share a bed. The down side would be that they aren't terribly clean. Ours had indoor outdoor carpet which is a different texture. Due to that there were several places that had things smashed into the carpet. Vacuuming obviously wasn't going to get that out, but obviously no one was going to do anything else since the stuff stayed there. And speaking of vacuuming they don't vacuum the rooms daily. Our carpet was a mess on day 2 and the maid took about 10 minutes in our room (I was outside waiting to lay down as I had a headache) but she never vacuumed. She also left her cleaning supplies in our kitchen, I don't know if she used them. No one came to retrieve them and since maid service ends at 3pm and she didn't get to our room until about 2:40 we figured she was done for the day. Another problem is lighting. If you don't light the room well it doesn't hide the dirt. The lighting was especially poor in the vanity area, try putting on makeup in the semi dark. That being said we get to the bathroom. I went to use it when we got there and realized that someone had used it before me. Completely gross! Realizing that the front desk was probably going to do nothing but flush that's what I did and didn't bother them. But later I was wondering if our room had even been cleaned, if it was how did that get there? But even better was after flushing the toilet had stains in it. Come on, who wants stains in a motel toilet. Next we get to the beds which are tempurpedic and that's nice. The sheets on the other hand are a streaky beige color. I'm not saying that they aren't clean, but they definitely are not white and they are not a dyed beige. I came upon the answer to this washing my hands with hot water in the bathroom sink that drains slow. The hot water is brown. I don't know why, my husband says the pipes are corroding and that's okay and natural. Maybe I'm sensitive but I don't want my water to be brown. But on the other hand at least I knew the sheets weren't really dirty. The amenities are nice here and that's why my kids love this place. We come too early for the splash playground and outdoor pool but they look okay. The indoor pool is a kind of playground which my kids love. The lifeguards are attentive, and it's good they have lifeguards because we've been places that haven't. They have movies you can rent for free at the front and games also. The rooms have DVD players. There is free mini golf, which is great. The problem is the course is old and damaged, most holes have the 'green' missing in parts and pulling up. The wood under the holes is warped so the balls will go off in odd directions. On the other hand the 'buildings' in the course had been freshly painted. It was an odd mix. I really want to like this place because my kids do but for me it just doesn't stack up. It's priced reasonably but I don't like staying somewhere that is dirty. It's family owned and they promote that. I just wish the family would take a bit better care with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids/grandkids!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl2958
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have taken our grandson here every year since 2005. This place is fantastic!!!! We have stayed in most of the room types (except for inside the main building). Every room type has been well-maintained, clean, and are a very good size. There are plenty of activities going on all day and into the evening. They have mini-golf on-site, basketball courts, playgrounds, a pond for fishing in the derby. They hold scavenger hunts, crafts, and other activities. The staff is great!! One year, we built a "boat" out of cardboard and duct tape (but, alas, it did not float :(....LOL) Everything on the resort is pirate-themed. They have an indoor pool area, which has a slide, net for volleyball, buckets that dump water (usually on my head!!!) fooseball, and they show movies on a big screen over the pool. Outside, they have an outdoor pool--very nice!!! Also outside is the "sprayground", a huge pirate ship with slides, water spouting from the ground, another set of buckets. Every area has lifeguards--very safe. They also run a shuttle from the hotel to Ocean City's Boardwalk and beach. They have movie and board game rentals for your room. They also have a 50's themed diner in the lobby---great food, great prices!! I would highly recommend this resort for anyone with children or grandchildren.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and smelled of urine”
Reviews.Author: Nila C
Reviews.Content: my family and i booked 4 rooms for friday night, april 27th, 2012. upon entering 3 of the rooms, we noticed a faint smell of urine. the floors of all the rooms were dirty; they didn't appear to be vacuumed since the last guests. we found hair in the tub and sink, as well as ants around various places in the room. i feared laying my head on the pillow because of the lack of cleanliness of the rooms. i would not book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: lolee56
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice once in June 2010 and again in June 2011 both time's with my grandsons. In 2010 I took them on my own and in 2011 we went with the whole family son, daughter in-law, grandsons and step-grand son. This is a great place for family's, good location, lots to do right at the hotel with the pools and the splash area, movies , fishing in their pond. When we come back to Ocean City this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “President's Day Deal”
Reviews.Author: Simply S
Reviews.Content: Decent beds, decent shower, decent rates. Kids love the pool water snake and slide, amount of chlorine will render any viruses or bacteria you bring in instantly sterile.

Reviews.Title: “our 5th time staying there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crumbun
Reviews.Content: In the winter we like to take our grandson to his favorite place and this is it. From the time we get there till the time to check out he is in the pool. Great price for the value. They have a local discount that really saves, we always stay aleast 2 nights but with the savings we can stay 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip for the value”
Reviews.Author: SWEECIE
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day 2 night stay at this resort. I think for the price I paid this a great deal. I am a seasoned traveler that has stayed at many 5 star hotels throughout the Caribbean and in the United States. The staff here was very friendly and accommodating. Even though this was off season there were still plenty of things to do with the kids. In fact I traveled by myself with my 7 year old twins and I found this resort very relaxing. The indoor pool was a great addition and given the water was only 4 feet I did not have to be in the pool to keep a careful watch over them. I could easily see what they were doing no matter where I sat. The only problem I found with this pool was there was so much chlorine that my daughter and I both developed very bad headaches after sitting in there for a couple of hours. The next time I will put a limit on how long we stay in that indoor pool area. The rooms were clean but even though they were updated in 2010 because we stayed in New Jersey's rooms, they still left something to be desired. I had a problem with spiders and stink bugs in the room. The walls are on the thin side so be prepared to hear all of your neighbors noises. Other than that the room was comfortable. We also enjoyed the movies that were showed every evening at 8:00 with the complimentary movie theater popcorn. Although we brought our food with us, in walking distance across the street there were many inexpensive fast food restaurants. My kids did not want to leave and said it was their best trip ever; they too have been to many, many islands and Disney World so that tells you a lot. Overall if you are on a budget and still want to have fun with your family, this is the place to go. I hope to visit there in the summer when there is more amenities available.

Reviews.Title: “Family-friendly FSK is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mom2matt
Reviews.Content: The Francis Scott Key Family Resort is the most family-friendly hotel we have stayed at away from the boardwalk! We venture to OC twice a year - usually Spring Break and Summer just before school begins. During the spring we like to stay on the boardwalk because it is not crowded and we love to walk alot. But during the summer, we love the FSK for several reasons: the rooms are spacious and clean, plenty of parking, lots of activities for kids of all ages, free shuttle to the boardwalk, etc... Our teens love the shuttle service, and since they have cells phones, we let them travel as a group and they love the freedom! The pool does get crowded at times and the room has an echo, but we let the children decided if they feel comfortable staying or choosing another activity. Lots of room for bikes and skateboards, too. The guest laundry is in the same building with the pool, so I can do our laundry before we go home while the kids are swimming. The exercise room is right there, also. The restaurant in the main bldg. is cool - a 50's theme, and our son loves the cartoons at the table (dvd player looping). The proximity to the shopping center, restaurants, gas station, and other amusements is great - withing walking distance. The kids love walking to Baja Amusements and allow us to tag along with $$ - we are so lucky... Mione's has the best pizza ever! The only negative thing I can say is a few years ago we stayed in May when the car cruisers were in town and taking up the parking, etc. One or two inconsiderate cruisers revved up their extremely loud and annoying engines late at night and early in the morning, which caused me a few headaches (I really need some peace from 12AM-6AM... silly me...). Of course this was no fault of the hotel, only the rude guests, which can happen anywhere. Needless to say, we love the FSK and will keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Second time not necessarily a charm”
Reviews.Author: MomofTwo0516
Reviews.Content: My family and I made what we hoped to be an annual trek to the Francis Scott Key resort for Spring Break. I guess we should have known it could not top our last experience. For those that haven't read my previous review, check it out. Once again the room was neat and clean, this time we opted for a full kitchen so we could do some of our own meals. Check in was a breeze and the property is clean with lots to do. Unfortunately lots of other peeps had the same plan. The hotel was packed with some loud and rowdys. The pool was over crowded and some of the kids were really rough. My son got hurt twice and the kids didn't really have any room to swim around. Last year I couldn't get them out of the pool, this week they were done after about and hour or so. We couldn't get a table to sit at and chairs were scarce as well. Clean towels were readily available and the life guards were nice and courteous. Our second day we had a nice lunch by the lake and fed the geese and turtles, the kids loved that. The pool once again was over crowded and wifi wasn't working, at least not for my kindle fire. Our last night we couldn't even find a parking space near our room and cable died in the middle of a movie we were watching. On the up side, they offered several family movie times with free popcorn but we were not able to attend any of them. We did get a free movie rental of the new Smurfs movie and each room has a DVD player. The beds are comfy with lots of pillows. Rooms are clean and smelled fine (I've read reviews that the rooms were musty but ours was fine). We played the free mini golf course and played volley ball in their sanded volley ball court. There is also a nice play area and picnic/grilling area. The lake is quiet and peaceful and there is an area for kids to ride their bikes. I guess it is good for them that it was so busy but they just don't have the pool space to accommodate a full hotel. My suggestion would be to expand the indoor pool area so there could be more pool space and more seating, maybe some more slides and toys. Our second day, they had removed the floating toys so there was nothing but the dumping water and small slide. The pool is really geared to young ones, upgrading would keep my 8 and 11 year old happier. Their favorite thing about the pool last year was the snake in the middle that they spent hours climbing on, swimming under, over, around... This time it was some fake logs and they couldn't get close to it there were so many kids and then it was gone, probably to make space for all the peeps. I guess this is what happens when you have such a great experience, nothing will ever live up to it again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a friendly getaway....”
Reviews.Author: Lakisha W
Reviews.Content: Francis Scott Key Resort was actually a great experience for the family...everyone was as friendly as expected. The rooms were very clean,the only thing that really turned the family off was their was no microwave to heat the free pizza, we had recieved from the front desk...:) later that night..even though cold works for me! Being our first time there,the outlets across the street were a lil under construction but still managing to stay open to serve us.. They had really great local eating spots which were all family oriented.This was actually a great getaway for the family..I would recommend this location to anyone..We as a family can't wait to come back with more of the family..My twin girls that are four really enjoyed themselves..Even learned how to swim while we were there...Thanks again..please just give them a try guarantee you'll enjoy..thanks again the JOHNSON FAMILY!!

Reviews.Title: “Yeah! Our Family is coming back to FSK this June!”
Reviews.Author: Dayzee504
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone:) Even though its freezing outside here in Delaware my family and I are super excited knowing that we reserved our rooms at Frances Scott Keys Family Resort:)today:) Because my son having Autism and balance isnt the best and my leg conditions having all of us on the same floor is a Godsend so I can walk out of my room and see my other sisters and their families every morning:) its our own family reunion. Im praying we can all be on the lower floor(myself and another sister already are) but my oldest sister who makes the reservations is on the top floor :(but I know that FSK's amazing reservation specialist will work something out for our family:) Because I am low income this trip is always the highlight of our summer. I dont get out much so this is the best time to spend time with my sisters going to the boardwalk that is a few minutes away with the amazing convenience of FSK's Shuttle service that goes to and from the Boardwalk every half an hour!! Love that and it drops us right off at the entrance of the boardwalk, my son for years has called it "the shuttle bus" mommy:) Restaurant on the premise and outlets across the street and everyone at FSK is so nice and friendly which is so refreshing:) My son has been talking about FSK resort since Christmas lol now he wants mommy to get out his swim trunks lol Wow I just thought of something:) Alex is 17 and we have been coming to FSK resort since he was around 6! This is an amazing year for him, he will be 18, graduates high school:) AND is going to Frances Scott Keys Resort with his loving family:) The rooms are clean and decorated in happy colors and when you have autism you are aware of everything and he is super happy everytime we come! We will be there!! with Swim trunks and bathtowels in hand!! Anyone who has never been to FSK resort, please go and experience what brings our family back year after year and the neat thing is that we add a person or two each year we come:) Have an Amazing Happy Summer! p.s. Guess what! my son STILL has all of our anket/bracelets from the first time we came to Frances Scott Keys Resorts and all the brochures for each year:) too cool:)

Reviews.Title: “Our weekend”
Reviews.Author: Pamela R
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying our stay was great, I was me my husband, 2 children and mother in law who came. the staff was friendly and the indoor pool was great and temperature of pool was great! Our room was very clean and everything was stocked. we stayed in the Virginia building and it was an older model room. The only problem that we did have is our room from teh second we opened our door on friday until we departed on sunday was that our room smelt like mildew or maybe even mold. we had to leave our door and windows open to air out the room and we sprayed perfume to maybe help with the smell. I am planning another trip for april and I would love to stay at this hotel again because my children loved it. I just dont want to have to deal with a smell like that Other then that The hotel was great. I really wish the diner was open we were looking forward to trying the food. and I must add the beds were sooooo comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice winter get-away with the kids.”
Reviews.Author: birder87
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We booked a special offer over the phone that I saw on their Website. The indoor pool was great, just the overall features are not meant to entertain the older teen set, however lots of teens were having a great time anyway, playing with the volleyball set up in the pool and the hot tub is great for the adults. We enjoyed going to the family room for a big screen TV movie, very comfy seating to lounge on. Also we enjoyed the DVD library for in room movies. The 18 whole mini golf is certainly adequate for fun, after all it is not meant to be a fancy "stand alone" mini golf business. Our room was very clean and had been renovated. New carpet, tile, tub, cabinets, etc. I like the "Mom and Pop" feel of the place and it has been/is being updated with new siding but still has the friendly old fashioned style. It is nice to have trees and picnic areas around and not be in a concrete jungle but yet you can walk to Dumser's for ice cream, restaurants, shopping, etc. It is also near some big go -cart tracks (closed for the season now though). The one downside was that there was one loud room of people (laughing and carrying on - not being crude or anything) the first night; it wasn't very sound-proof, otherwise a very relaxing time. All of the kids had a great time and want to go back, ages 6 - 13. I'd go back too. The 50's diner looked cool but it was closed because of being "off season".

Reviews.Title: “The Kids Didn't Want To Go Home!”
Reviews.Author: HopCop2006
Reviews.Content: The last time I visited the Ocean City area was over 20 years ago before I had kids so when I searched the internet for family friendly accommodations and found Francis Scott Key Family Resort I was pleasantly surprised by their informative website! Any questions I still had were answered over the phone by very friendly staff. We booked a kitchenette room in the New York building since we had a family of six and found the room to be very clean. The mattress topper for the sleeper sofa was a great plus! The TemperPedic double beds were very comfortable- perfect since we have them at home too. The heater worked wonderfully- almost too well since it was unseasonably warm this week- no problem since we could adjust the temp with a press of a button! We didn't tell the kids about the pirate-themed indoor pool and BOY were they SURPRISED! It was just the right size and had just the right amount of built-in fun for our four kids ages 2 through 9! I was worried at first that our room wasn't close enough to the indoor pool but it wasn't far at all! We just brought a change of dry clothes and used the locker/changing areas before taking a short walk back to our room. Having PLENTY of clean dry towels made available to guests at the pool was a 5 star plus! During our stay we made use of the arcade, pond (tip: wild geese are not keen on being fed by kids- they just fly away!), playground, basketball court (I think you can borrow a ball from the front desk if you forget to bring your own), and mini golf course! (get putters and golfballs from the front desk- for free!) My older two kids loved being able to watch a family movie with free popcorn at night in the comfy family room next to the front desk area. We liked that room so much we even came back the next day and brought our own board game and my son made a new friend when he invited another kid to join the game! Even though the 50's themed-diner was closed for the season, there were tons of dining options nearby and of course, in downtown OC. With the kitchenette in our room we even had our own spaghetti night- luckily we brought our own very large pot- though the kitchenette was fully stocked with everything else!) A Royal Farms convenience store is just a short walk away as is the outlet mall across Route 50! I'm looking forward to returning with my family again next year....I'm even checking the kids' school calendar to see when they'll be off again so we can stay longer! Thanks, FSK Family resort!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas break family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: cwnhokie
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute trip over Christmas break with our three boys ages 4,9, and 10. We thought about driving to Disney World or one of the indoor water park resorts a little closer to home. I stumbled upon this place searching the internet for something fun, closer and cheaper than those options. Friends and family asked where we were staying and what street the hotel was on in Ocean City, they were concerned when I told them we were staying at a motel just outside of Ocean City. When we got close my husband thought it would be funny to take a picture of a dive motel down the street to send home to our family as a prank. Once that was done we continued on to the Francis Scott Key Family Resort. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was in the Florida building on the top floor close to the indoor pool as I had requested. The room was clean and we could tell it had been remodeled recently. There were plenty of towels and pillows. We were excited to try out the TemperPedic mattresses since were had recently thought about buying one. There was even one to lay over the pull out section of the chair. The kitchen had everything we could have needed to make meals, but all we used it for was the refrigerator to hold our take out containers. The lighting was a little dark as I read in a previous review and the blinds were pretty but let a lot of light in from the light fixture outside the door. For us it was a good night light. The stairs going up to the room need to be repainted but that was the only thing we found to be in need of maintenance. Indoor Pool: This was the best part of our trip. We wanted somewhere to just hang out and spend some relaxing time together as a family and this was perfect. The pool had plenty of fun for all the boys volleyball, the slide, dumping buckets and the snake to climb on. The pool went from about 2ft to 4ft with plenty of room to play. My husband and I enjoyed the hot tub a little bit but the boys were disappointed that they couldn't go in especially since we have one at home, but they understood. The lifeguards were attentive and friendly. Our boys played in the pool for several hours all three days we were there. They also had a nice clean locker room, arcade, laundry and fitness room. Outside: It was too cold to do anything outside but I was able to check it out when I went for a little jog around the property. They have an outdoor pool and a pirate ship with slides and dumping buckets etc to get wet. The miniature golf course and sand volleyball looked well maintained. There was also a pavilion with picnic tables and grills and a pond with lots of geese. The 50s style restaurant was closed for the season, but the menu looked tasty. They also have shuttles to the beach that run in season. The resort is just outside of OC right before you go across the bridge. Activities: They had movies and popcorn each afternoon and evening which we didn't make it too since one of our boys wasn't feeling well the night we were going to go, but we were able to borrow a movie from the front desk to watch in the room. There are lots of restaurants, shopping and things to do within walking distance. I could imagine that this resort might get busy and loud in the summer months with all the kids running around having tons of fun, but I would definitely recommend this resort and already have to friends. We have already talked about going back next year for Christmas break again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Winter Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6, the price was great, the family atmosphere awesome, the pool area was thoroughly enjoyed by all! The staff was more than helpful. Movies and popcorn in the main building after the pool closed allowed for some later night fun for the bigger kids and adults as well. Room was very clean and well kept. Will definetly schedule another winter break because you cannot beat the value!

Reviews.Title: “You don't have to be Ocean Front to have the best of OC!”
Reviews.Author: passaskat
Reviews.Content: Just like me, you have most likely driven into to OC on Route 50 and barely gave that odd old brick buildintg a second glance - ya know - the one just before the drawbridge. I am so glad I finally checked it out. 7 members of my family stayed at FSK for our annual "Women's Weekend". Our ages ranged from 2 - 62 and everyone had a blast.
