Housekeeping did a nice job with our room every day. LOCATION: walking distance to grocery store/outlets across the street/harbour restraunts down the road. 10 minutues to Assateague. ELBOW ROOM: We bring 4 bikes on the back of our vehicle, so the ample parking ,roomy campus was a plus for us. QUIET FAMILY ATMOSPHERE: quiet after 11PM, AMENITIES: Shuttle bus, golf, b-ball hoop, pools. Shuttle was very convenient. OTHER: We had a 2 double bed room w/ small fridge - I was expecting the usual 18 inch cube fridge but it was a roomy 3 ft tall one. Helpful, friendly staff. Some negatives I read about before our stay concerned me and our experiences were: We had 2 flies in our room, but what is to be expected in summer with a door to outside? They might have flown in while we were bringing in our stuff. I saw no evidence of any other bugs. We stayed in a room that had not been remodeled for 2010 and it was older paneling etc. but it was CLEAN. The shuttle was sometimes crowded, but it still beat trying to find a parking spot downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Family with Kids”
Reviews.Author: lovefamily_10
Reviews.Content: I tried this resort just based on the reviews from travel advisor. I have a 7year and 2 year old boys and we loved this resort and we stayed in the remodeled room with Kitchen - New Jersey building and the room was very clean with a well stocked kitchen. it is 1 mile away from the beach and during summer they have a schuttle van every 5-10 minutes going to the beach and it is very convenient. the indoor pool and the golf putt is very good for family fun. we did not have any complaints about any service.

Reviews.Title: “Basic motel, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: NYCRonnie
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to this hotel because of the amenities. This proved to be a winner for our young children who are not that enamored with the beach. The motel is very basic. We stayed in a remodeled room which was very clean but extremely basic. If you stay here make sure you request a remodeled room. The staff is extremely courteous and they address your concerns immediately. We enjoyed our stay but I would not stay again as I like places that are a tad more modern. I highly recommend this establishment for families with children who are budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Indoor Pool”
Reviews.Author: jack21903
Reviews.Content: The indoor pool area is wonderful. Love all the activities for kids, whether indoors or out. The volleyball, the mini-golf, the pools, the trails. Great family fun!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it if you don't have kids!”
Reviews.Author: DDiamondgirl55
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and well run motel IF YOU HAVE KIDS..... if no little ones, skip it since most everything is geared toward children's entertainment. The rooms are nice and there are a variety of room options from basic to ones including a full kitchen all for reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: guy241
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 8/17 to 8/20 in Room 308 in the Main Lodge. This room is on the third floor, to the rear, a little bit of a climb, but not bad. The room was spacious and clean. The double beds, although they should be Queen Beds, were very comfortable. The bathroom is a little small, and the major drawback of our vacation, was that the bathroom only has a pedistial sink. There was no where to put any items, this made a quite unenjoyable expiericence when it came to getting ready. All they need would be some type of shelf in there. Also, under the sink, the pipes were ugly, exposed, rusted and just a overall mess. The bottom of the bath tub had a anti slip surface, that made it appear that the tub was dirty. We would have liked a small refrig in the room as the Ice Machine was on the ground floor by the front desk. All in all we will stay here again, it is a great place, the kids enjoyed all the pools and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay – looking forward to next year already!”
Reviews.Author: LindaVan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2nd year at FSK – 6 days of family fun! We may need to add a couple more days next year just to fit in everything we didn't have a chance to do this time around! We chose to stay in a renovated room (with kitchen efficiency) and were pleased with the updates (although our stay last year in an older room was just fine – I don't mind older as long as its CLEAN which it truly was!) My 5 and 8 year old love the Pirate sprayground, indoor pool, mini golf (which is now free all the time!) and outdoor pool, and were quite excited about the new Route 50 Diner. Its a bit like staying at a summer camp for families (with nicer accommodations of course!), and is perfectly located near the beach, shopping and local attractions. As a single mom I feel totally comfortable here with my kids – safe, clean, and very convenient when you only have one pair of hands! I prefer to drive my own van to the beach/boardwalk, but the shuttle is a wonderful option. I continue to tell all I know about FSK and look forward to summer 2011!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PKELLY1221
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first trip to Ocean City, MD and staying at the FSK Family Resort. We had a great time but most of all, our children had a blast. We didn't know what to expect because there are a lot of mixed reviews on here. We stayed in the Pennsylvania building and we thought the room was clean. We thought the room was nicely decorated and the beds were very comfy. Our building had been updated but there were some things that we noticed that could use refurbishment, for example, some of the hinges on the doors were rusty. The T.V. was a little small but the hotel is not a fancy hotel nor does it claim to be. The kids were able to borrow DVD's from the front desk and watch them in the room. The women at the front desk were very nice and helpful. We had lunch at the 50's diner one day and breakfast on another. We thought the food was good. My children loved all of the amenities. My boys are 4 and 3 years old and the indoor water park was perfect for them. It was especially great because it rained one day and it kept the kids occupied. The arcade was nice. The outdoor pool was very nice as well. My boys liked the Pirate spray park. It was closed on a rainy day and when the sun came out, the staff hustled to open it right away for the kids to enjoy. Overall, we would definitely stay at FSK again! for a little longer Our family had a wonderful time! FSK is a great hotel for families with young children! We felt that FSK resort was a great value as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families with children!”
Reviews.Author: arb50
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a short vacation to this resort. The indoor pool, the pirate ship was a hit with the children in my family. The 50's diner was great also. The shuttle was very convenient. My room needed updating. The drawers would not close easily. The knobs were falling off the drawer. The top lock on the door was broken. The bathroom faucet was old and rusty. The coffee pot was old and the cup that holds the coffee kept falling off. A microwave would have been a great addition. Even with the needed updating. I would return to stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Shoney75
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this so called "resort". This hotel was built in 1954, and the rooms have not been touched since. We travel all the time, but my disappointment in this old/run-down room owershadowed my entire trip. The room still has wood paneling walls, popcorn ceilings, and dirty, smelly carpet. We also had a noise coming from the wall at night. We even requested a better room, and was denied unless we paid more money. The best thing about the motel was the kids water activities and the shuttle to the beach. I tried to enjoy my day, but the thought of having to return to that room ruined my entire day. I was too excited to return to the comfort of my own home. This motel really need to renovate asap.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Party heaven”
Reviews.Author: ToesNdeSand
Reviews.Content: We took a young group of kids here ofr the weekend and had a birthday party in their indoor pool area. I have to say that the staff was friendly and made the young man's birthday experience a great one. The tropical pool is very clean and entertaining for the kiddos. Anyone who is looking to have a p[ool party for their childs birthday should check this out!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Francis Scott Key”
Reviews.Author: dman3527
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another stay at the Francis Scott Key and will be returning in the future like always. They've done a great job with remodeling of the lobby, the Rt.50 diner and the sitting room. They also did a great job as well with the remodeled rooms as we stayed in one. As always, the kids loved the indoor waterpark and the pirate ship spray park. We also hit the outdoor pool where they get to swim and I can get an adult beverage at the bar and relax. We played some putt-putt,some volleyball, and my 2 year olds played at the playground. With 4 children you just can't beat all thats provided to you at the Francis Scott Key. I've read some complaints about the air conditioning and the timing of the busing system at Francis Scott Key and really don't understand that. They don't have to provide this service and though I don't use it, I think its a great amenity. Needless to say our family will be back again next summer and are lookin at coming for a weekend in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: red91799
Reviews.Content: We stayed here june 27th thru July 4th 2010 . This was our fist visit and we will definantly return. Our children loved everything about the resort! The indoor pool was a hit . I loved the outdoor pool myself and just being able to relax on a chair take in some sun while watching my twin 7 year olds have a bawl! Come see for yourself this place is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: nikkinicole
Reviews.Content: A few days before our visit, I read the 2 bad reviews below and got more than a little freaked out. I can deal with alot of roadblocks on vacations but bugs in my room is not one of them. We even checked around for another place but nothing had any vacancy. So my sister call FSK and spoke to one of the owners about our concerns who assured us that we would not have a problem and I'm happy to say that she was right. Our room was very clean and I didn't see one bug-- not even an ant, during our entire stay (we stayed in the remodled New Jersey building). The rooms are far from fancy but I'd read enough on tripadvisor to know that ahead of time and we were ok with that. We were there for the pools and splashpad and were not disappointed. The ages of the kids in our group were 2, 7 and 10 and they all had a GREAT time enjoying all of those things. Considering the amount of kids there, I was happy to find the pools clean and most often not overcrowded (til saturday night but that's to be expected I think) and little details like fresh towels available. The diner there was cute but we got a bad waitress- she was nice but horribly lacking in experience- our whole section was being grossly neglected and breakfast took forever to get through. There was a male waiter who seemed to be much better; I wish we'd had him. My only complaint has nothing to do with the motel itself- I just hated where it was. Unfortunately that part of OC seems to attract a partcularly redneck-y crowd. I was awake both nights around midnight-1am listening to arguing and cursing loudly and even at the pool during the day had to listen to other patrons jovially but loudly calling each other certain slurs that I'd rather not have to hear on vacation. But that seems to be the crowd, as alot of that is on the boardwalk too. In all fairness, I could have called the front desk and maybe they'd have remedied the late night situation but it wasn't really worth it to me. The beach there on the southern end is gross too- dirtier and much more crowded than farther north, where I've stayed on other occasions. But this will come as no surprise to anyone who has stayed in southern OC, I would think. We did spend our last day at Assateague which I hadn't realized is only 12 minutes from the resort, and it was wonderful. I wish we'd gone there the day before as well. As I stated my complaints were more about southern OC and not the resort but I wanted to mention it. Overall, the FSK was a great value for the money if you have small kids and I was very pleasantly surprised after reading some of the recent negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation spot ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pam1964
Reviews.Content: We loved FSK, didn't want to leave, and would return in a heartbeat. We stayed in an efficiency room that adjoined to indoor pool, arcade and laundry. Room was clean and had everything we needed, and the layout allowed for multiple private spaces for changing, grooming since the sink area was separate from the shower / toilet. Beds were very comfortable. Pool areas were great with my kids especially loving the indoor pool and I especially loving the hot tubs. Mini putt-putt was a nice perk and a nice way to get the family together without having to spend extra money. 50Diner was good - remember to get your wristbands on early so you can get the 10% discount. One night they served fresh baked mini-donuts that were wonderful! Picnic pavilion offered a nice space to eat and we got to see a great lightning show during a storm one evening. Reservation area and adjoining rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. Property was well-kept. Pirate ship spray park was great for little kids, but my 10 year old also spent several hours their and enjoyed it. Met a number of people who have been returning for many years and they say hotel keeps growing and getting better. Outlet stores across the street offered another great way to spend time for the shopping lovers. Shuttle to beach was really convenient and I loved having access to the beach and the boardwalk while being able to retreat to the relative quiet and relaxed atmosphere of the hotel. Only real inconvenience we ran into was the slow internet connection which was almost unusable between 10 - 11 pm. We worked around that by hitting the vending machines after 10 and I loved the frozen milky ways! Laundry was very clean, convenient and VERY affordable. I really appreciated that the hotel truly offered this as an amenity, rather than trying to get more profit as the laundry service was very low cost compared to other places I've stayed. Really great hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Unhealthy room situations!”
Reviews.Author: KNKSnavely
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had been going to Francis Scott Key for years but after this year we will not be back. We arrived for a 5 day stay, and were put in a room in the Carolina building, the carpet was damp and the room wreaked of mold or mildew. I called the front desk and they sent a housekeeper over to confirm the smell and she said it also wreaked of mold when she walked in. My friend is asthmatic and I didn't appreciate the fact that they would put anyone in that room at all. So then we were moved to another room for that night, which thankfully had no smell at all, and another room, for the following three nights. We were treated like an inconvenience for calling and asking about what kind of room we were going to be put in next, and when we were to move to another room and a front desk clerk came to give us our keys he didn't even offer to help us carry our bags despite the huge inconvenience of having to unload our things three different times. I think if anything they should've offered us even a free meal at the 50's diner for the inconvenience or something but they were non apologetic. They were irritated with us at the front desk for constantly having to request new keys until they finally sent someone up to find that the battery in our door lock was dead....There were cheesy cracker crumbs all over the floor when we were moved to our third room as well as ants in the sink, the vents on the ac were filthy, and our third room which was back in the Carolina building but on the second floor smelled musky and the carpet was damp as well. Two of us became very ill after our stay, though I know it is unfair to say for sure it was the hotel, I don't feel the quality of the rooms, smells, and dirty ac vents could've helped.....

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach Motel”
Reviews.Author: rx1997
Reviews.Content: Within the first 15 minutes of arriving and unloading our car, my husband killed a cockroach on the wall and left the remains for proof. It was 4 pm. I have read if you see one during the day, there is a huge infestaton. We were upgraded to another room in another building. There were ants and other bugs in that room. We stayed two nights and we had enough. We felt like there were cockroaches in that room as well. My husband spoke to other guests who have also seen them on the property. We did get most of our money back. I think we should have received a refund of the entire amount since this experience had ruined our vacation. We are now apprehensive to go to any hotel. We ended up at the Courtyard by Marrriot. It was a beautiful and clean hotel but we had trouble getting comfortable. For your information, the first room was quickly occupied. They claimed they did not see any roaches in that room. We did leave the remains of the roach on the wall. I have to say this was sad because our kids did enjoy the indoor pool and pirate ship water spray area. We were afraid to bring our belongings into our home. We left everything in the car and then let one of those roach insecticide "bombs" off. Then I had to wash all the clothes at the laundrymat. To this day, my husband feels like bugs are crawling on him.

Reviews.Title: “Great time was had by all!!”
Reviews.Author: virtualruby
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Francis Scott Key and with my 10 month old. The room we booked was a remodeled one with a kitchen and it was immaculate and we loved it. The amenities that the hotel promises on the website are all accurate.. We LOVED the shuttle service and used it every time we went to the beach. There was never more than a 10 minute wait and with a baby this is a definite plus. My son loved the splash area and pools and i cant wait for him to get a bit bigger and take more advantage of the amenities that are here. I do wish that there was a gift shop.. i do not know why they do not have one because it is a missed opportunity and there are so many nice items online for sale.My only complaint is that the people who stayed above our room were sometimes loud, especially on our last night and it woke us up.. i was ready to go to the front desk but decided against it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not for large families”
Reviews.Author: carpediem628
Reviews.Content: FSK is great for small families with small children. However, if you are looking for fun on your vacation, it's not the place to go, and if you are with a group of adults, go somewhere else. My family was constantly reported as making too much noise. The problem is, they welcomed my family reunion of over 60 people to their motel, but placed us all on the second floor. We had nearly 30 children in total. They placed us over top other guests who were there with their babies and small families, and then complained to us that we were too noisy. What they neglected to acknowledge is that balcony floors are hollow, and therefore, just walking regularly sounded as if we were jumping up and down. My 2 year old, 25 pound granddaughter sounded like she weighed 150 pounds whenever she'd run around. The walls are thin so regular everyday sounds, coming from 60+ people, sounded far worse than they were. Sometimes people reported that we were making noise when we weren't even there. We had to have a conversation with the owner in which she acknowledged that perhaps there was an intolerance by the other guests for our large group. My group was not perfect - far from it. In fact, one person in our group got drunk and was taken to jail. I felt extremely embarrassed. The people in our group that were staying in the same building as the drunk were all kicked out as a result. As disappointed as I was, I had no hard feelings until the following night, I was accosted by a group of drunken FSK guests in which they accused me of hitting their car when I had come no where near their car. FSK security came and pointed out to the drunks that it was obvious no accident had occured. But the drunks insisted on calling the police on me. It was so distressing for me to be accused and accosted by a group of drunken men and women screaming at me about something that did not occur, yet the following morning, they were not kicked out of the hotel. Makes me wonder. Next year, we will gladly give our money to a place that is built to handle real people on vacation with children, who are fair to all guests, and who have enough commonsense not to place a group of 60 over top someone's head knowing the structure of the building is poor. And that won't be FSK.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: gbstone
Reviews.Content: We went with a number of other families. Everyone in our group agreed that the hotel was an excellent choice as a place to stay. We were placed in one of the newly remodeled rooms so I can't speak for the older rooms or the cabins, however our room was clean and the appliances in excellent working order. We had teenage girls in our group and the all enjoyed themselves in both the indoor and outdoor pool. There was a sprayground, which was on the young side for my daughters, however my nephew enjoyed it endlessly. The staff was helpful and courteous and the cleaning staff did a terrific job every day, going above and beyond what we've normally experienced at a hotel (e.g. washing all our dirty dishes and pans). Like other reviewers we ran into the loud, late night revelers and the out of control kids in the pool. We found both to be part of the same group, I believe one of them said it was a family reunion. A few of our families complained and after 2 warnings this group was asked to leave. Things were much better afterwards and the families in our group that complained were compensated with a hotel gift certificate and a free one night stay. The free shuttle to the beach was a big plus. It was reliable and convenient and our group used it heavily. The location of the hotel was very convenient. It's only a minute drive to the beach and is located near many handy stores, outlets, and restaurants, though you wouldn't know it when walking around the resort as it felt very secluded. They had a nice large pavilion out back with a number of grills which were used by a number a families plus a fireplace that was well stocked with wood. Our group hung out there till late at night as it was away from the rooms were we wouldn't bother anyone. If you're looking for a family place to stay I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreAllieCat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay at the FSK resort. The resort had a lot to offer. An indoor pool w/ slide, jacuzzi, and kiddie pool, outdoor pool with kiddie pool, and pirate sprayground were all big hits with our daughter. She had a blast. It was nice to have so much to do on-site. When we wanted to hit the beach or boardwalk, shuttles ran constantly and that was a big plus not to have to deal with driving and parking. On nights our daughter was exhausted we would just stay at the resort and walk to the main building for ice cream at the route 50 diner and borrow a movie from the front desk. They had puzzles and games for my daughter to play with while my husband used the internet on the computer for guest use. We stayed in a renovated room that was kept very clean. We even got some towel art from the maid service. A free crib was provided at our request. My gripes with the accomodations would be the poor water pressure and the paper thin walls....which leads me to my complaints... NOISE!!!! Oh my goodness, you can hear EVERYTHING in your room. You can hear your neighbors and all of the outside noise quite well. Quiet hours start a bit late for my taste (11 pm)...but I may be in the minority there as not everyone is travelling with a one year old. However, we had a few issues with past-quiet hour noise. The building across from hours had a large group that appeared to take up the entire top floor and they were LOUD. At midnight they were still keeping me up so I called the front desk to complain. The noise never subsided and I slept with a pillow on my head. I went to complain in person the next morning and was told it would not be a problem again. I was pleasantly surprised to not have any issues that night, however, by that point we were sleeping with my daughter's white noise machine turned all the way up and leaving the TV on all night. The next night the screaming was so loud at 2 am that they woke up my one year old. My husband called the front and was told the police were coming. By the time I got my daughter back to sleep (45 minutes later) it was silent. The next day the entire group in the other building was gone. After that the nights were quieter...though we still utilized all of our white noise methods to drown out noises such as car doors and the baby crying in the neighboring room. My other gripe also involves the other guests. We often ran into problems of unsupervised children...mostly at the outdoor pool. No one from the resort monitors the pool and the signs posted that children be accompanied by an adult go ignored. I can't tell you how many times the one foot baby pool was full of rowdy unsupervised (!!!) 6 year olds that splashed water everywhere and took my daughter's toys. I was constantly parenting other people's children and scolding them for harassing my one year old! It was unbelievable. I couldn't really enjoy my time with her because I was trying to keep some other person's child from dumping water on her head or dealing with 50 requests of "watch me put my head under the water!" We didn't run into this as much at the indoor pool, which you need your room key card to get into and has two life guards. I'm not sure why the outdoor pools don't have the same procedure? At least some sort of attendent to make sure children are supervised and to keep older children out of the baby pool. Although I loved the resort's amenities and found the staff to be generally courteous and helpful, I don't think we'll return. The sleepless nights and having to parent kids that aren't mine was a bit much for me. Such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: stitchnell
Reviews.Content: We received daily maid service which included them vacuming the floors; wiping down the sink and bathroom; provided fresh toilet paper, soap and shampoo; provided fresh towels and washcloths; made the beds; washed the bed linens 1/2 way through the week and even made animals out of towels and washcloths! It was so nice coming into a clean room everday and seeing what the animal was waiting for us in our room (elephant, turtoise, swans, etc). FSK provides shuttle service to and from downtown Ocean City. They have 2 shuttle buses that run every 20 minutes beginning at 9am until 10 pm. Drop off and pick up was a short walk to and from the boardwalk. We loved using the shuttle so we didn't have to drive, find and pay for parking and it saved us gas. FSK offers something for the entire family with having an indoor pool, an out door pool, a Pirate spray ground, exercise facility, family gathering area, game room area, a bar at the outdoor pool and free DVDs to watch. We LOVED FSK and will definately stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Motel”
Reviews.Author: sheral238
Reviews.Content: Francis Scott Key Motel and Resort is extremely clean, newly remodeled rooms, both pools and hot tubs are just great, and the new 50's Diner inside the hotel lobby has wonderfully, delicious meals at a good price and every guest receives a 10% discount. The beach shuttles are just great!! All the employees are so nice to deal with, we had a nice clean room every day, fresh towels, pools were clean and hot tub, quiet at night, parking was great, miniature golf was fun and free for guests, and geared to families and kids also. I would recommend to all, 100% great vacation. We also had the internet for our laptop and the use of a fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “As I write this, I am sitting in what is...”
Reviews.Author: Callalilycutie
Reviews.Content: As I write this, I am sitting in what is, really, a very nice sitting room downstairs. I'm sitting here at two in the morning because the people in the next room snore so loudly that it actually carries into the room my family is staying in. The woman at the front desk is not happy about me being here - she thinks that I will give a bad impression to any newcomers - and so she is sitting behind a darkened window, through which I can clearly see her working on a crossword while she does this. Ironically, a young man was just threatened by a random guest and came in to report it. As concerned as she is about me sitting here, she is none too concerned about the young man's safety. She calls security after he leaves and asks them to "swing by that area so the kid thinks you're looking into it." This experience kind of sums up my time here. The "adult pool" which boasts several signs warning those under the age of fifteen to stay out without an adult is overrun by unsupervised kids. The televisions are so old they can't even be called 'retro'. The tempurpedic beds? Not worth the price tag. What this is is a place that was once a quality resort, but is no longer. The saving grace is the shuttle, which picks you up and drops you off within feet of the boardwalk. It runs regularly and the drivers are the only staff members with an ounce of caring or understanding in their bodies. I don't plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Probably Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: AngiJ1981
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at this hotel since the early 1990's and loved the place until this year. The past stay we had was 5 days long. For 3 of the 5 days our hotel room was infested with ants. We reported the issue and the hotel said that they would take care of it. Basically they sent in a maid to clean and then also set an ant trap. This did not solve the problem. The hotel blamed it on the rain, but we hadn't even had rain for our time there! They did not offer to move us to a new room, and they did not offer a discount. My father had to raise a ruckus in order to get one of the nights we stayed free. What a horrible experience for a place that we usually love staying at! The service was not good, the retribution was unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed with flies,very bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: corwin56
Reviews.Content: We had no problem with check-in the problems started when we entered our room. We were greeted by (no exaggeration) at least 20-30 flies. My husband spent the first hour killing flies with the booklet received upon check-in. I can understand a few flies in the room, but what we saw was disgusting. The kicker is we were told the room was inspected before they let us in given we arrived prior to 3 p.m.. If it was inspected how were the flies missed??? A real turn off and bad first impression. The rest of our stay was o.k. until the night before we left. We got back to our room around 9 and our key card did not work. We went to the front desk to tell the staff and they were right on it. The maintenance guy was there by the time we got back to our room, but then had to go and get his tool box to ultimately fix the problem. He let us in the room with a key which would have been fine until the morning. The normal maintenance guy, a security man and the head of maintenance worked for an hour and a half fixing the door. They didn't leave until 10:45 p.m. with out even so much as an apology (we were nice and said thank you). I was lucky that I could get my 5 year old daughter to sleep, but I am 30 weeks pregnant and wanted nothing more then to go to sleep myself. Hard to do when you have three men in your room having trouble fixing card key system due to a stripped screw. I appreciate them fixing the problem right away, but it was something that could have waited until the next day after we checked out. The next day my Husband wanted to take our daughter fishing. He got the fishing poles by the outdoor pool and when he asked for bait he was told "use bread or hot dogs as they eat anything", really????. I guess our only option was to pick through the garbage for bait? We went over to the "stocked pond" and it is choked with so much algae that I am sure what ever fish were in the pond were suffocated and are no longer in there. One of the few positives about the trip was the shuttle to the beach. Were were recommended to FSK by a friend who had gotten the recommendation from some one else and had never been down there previously. The plan was to scope it out with a plan to return next year with our friend and another family next summer. I can tell you that won't be happening given the events of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE TO STAY WITH YOUNG CHILDREN!”
Reviews.Author: daviesfam
Reviews.Content: This was a hidden gem...we have never been to Ocean City and arrived there 7am with no idea where to stay. Agter a little driving around we drove past FSK and saw a pirate ship in the back of the building. We checked in ($190/night inside house) with great, comfy, tempurpedic beds and had breakfast at the on-site 50's diner restaurant. They have 2 pools great for young children. The inside pool is filled with a variety of slides, in pool whale toy, floating snake to ride on, vaolleyball and they also provide lifevests to use. The outside pool has a pool bar with happy hour and great for your teenagers. The pirate ship was the hit for our kids. 5+ slides, hideout holes and water shooting canyons. I was impressed when the staff go around and wipe down the chairs and tables everytime somoene leaves the pool. It felt very sanitary and you dont have that grungy feeling like other places. I think the price is well worth it here plus they provide a free shuttle to and from the beach/boardwalk about every 15-30 minutes. Great place to stay. The outside rooms along the side of the main house go for about $215 a night. They also have private family cottages too but I am not sure what they go for. We will definatley be back again next year for a longer stay if not again this year!!

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD AN AWESOME STAY AT THE FSK”
Reviews.Author: Cherryry
Reviews.Content: The Pirate Srayground and Indoor pool were a big hit with my 5 yr. old and is what she talks about most when we talk about our visit to OC. The hotel had a very cozy feel, clean rooms and nice grounds-GREAT FOR YOUNG KIDS!!! Very close to everything in Ocean City and we plan on returning next summer.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again, but stay away from Route 50 Diner”
Reviews.Author: junebug79NewYork
Reviews.Content: I would recommend to family/friends. It it a great place for families who are traveling with children. Beds are comfortable temperpedic. Cannot say that I was impressed with the vast majority of customer service or friendliness from it's employees, no one really seemed to care. Great that they provide a shuttle to and from the board walk/beach. Location is great, walking distance to shopping outlets and some great choices for food. However, I do not believe the Route 50 Diner inside the hotel is a great choice. Prices on the menu look favorable, until you recieve your food. Quanity and Quality is less than desireable. $7.00 for a childs meal that consists of hamburger that is the size of a 1/2 dollar and 10 french fries is not practical. Overall hotel is a good value, but may want to pick other choices for food!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Goofy_20
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here!The service during check in was wonderful! The girl that checked us in was so nice. When we got to the room it was very clean. I didnt see one bug or anything, as I read in other reviews. The beds were very comfy and with 6 people the room was a very good size to fit us comfortably. I really liked that they had games and movies available to borrow at the front desk, and the pools and playground were awesome. We are all in our early 20's but still love to play like kids sometimes! The only suggestion I would make is for the bathroom. The back part of our room had the bathroom to the left, but only a toilet and bathtub. The sink was outside the bathroom and around a little corner like a changing area that you couldnt see from the rest of the room. I can see their point in doing this so someone can use the mirror /sink while someone else is in the shower,but at the same time they should at least have a little curtain or sliding door between the bathroom and sink area so if you want to walk from the bathroom to the sink area to get dressed noone in the room can see you. It's not far from the boardwalk at all, maybe about a mile. Not far from the Walmart or grocery store either. I loved staying here and would do it again. Just keep in mind when you go the beach you will have to pay for parking since you're not staying at any of the hotels on the boardwalk. They WILL tow you if you dont have a parking pass for that hotel. Also, I liked the people that stayed there because everyone was very chilled and layed back . If you have children it is definately a great place for them with lots to do! They have a STRICT quiet time from 11pm to 8am and it really does stay quiet during those times even with all the kids that were there. They also have a little pavillion area where you can cook out and everything! I really recommend staying here, the price is not bad at all either!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with young children.”
Reviews.Author: pvijr10
Reviews.Content: The Francis Scott Key Resort is the best place to stay with young children. I have been going to Ocean City all my life and it was a very pleasent experience staying there. My family had a blast the family activities are like nowhere else in O.C. My family and I will be staying there again in the near future. The rooms are clean and quiet and the service was great from check-in to check-out. In closing this is a great family spot your kids will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach, but not a good value”
Reviews.Author: HoosierGal33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at FSK for 3 days and 4 nights with our 2 kids ages 9 and 5. We stayed in a room that was supposed to be remodeled for the 2010 season and had a fridge. It appeared the carpet and furniture may have been new, but nothing else in the room appeared to be remodeled. Our shower had very poor water pressure no matter the time of day and did not even have a curved curtain rod. Our first full day was July 4th and traffic on US 50 in front of the hotel was bumber to bumper all day, so we stayed at the hotel most of the day. The indoor water park was ok. It has one small slides, a baby area and a permanent volleyball net. There are varying degrees of deepness and FSK provides life guards and life preservers. It was nice to be indoors, but the pool was far from a 'water park'. My kids really enjoyed the sprayground with the pirate ship. I don't think the price was a value for the type of room we were booked into or the amenities. The Route 50 diner was nice to go to one time, as the prices were no better than going to somewhere off property. There is a Starbucks, Carabbas and two small diners within walking distance. I would not reccomend the diner directly next door. All in all i would not book in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: frqnttrvlr77
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the FSK 6 times but there wont be a 7th. The Marlin Moon Grille, price and location are what usually brought me back. Unfortunately the cleanliness of our room (my AC unit had bird feces , rust, and mold inside of it) ended the streak. If there were rooms available at the Hilton or Courtyard we would have moved, instead we lefdt a day early.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, much more than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: JamboBread
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the FSK resort and all I can say is that our trip was wonderful! We went with three other families and all the kids really enjoyed all the pools. The outdoor pool was great, the spray park was fantastic, and the indoor pool in the high heat was a a real hit! The only thing I could pick on was that one of the two busses was broken, but the hotel operators rented a van to replace the broken bus. Other hotel owners wouldn't do this. The driver of the bus sang the praises of the pawners. If your employees say you are great, it must be true! The new restaurant in the lobby was good, and we had breakfast there every day. The rooms were just re-done and the beds were great! Again, thanks for a wonderful vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “flies and ants in room”
Reviews.Author: smc02
Reviews.Content: I spent the first 2 nights chasing the fast moving flies and gave up eventually. My guess is they came in while the room was serviced. There is a small gap around the door and the frame so may be they came in that way too. They landed on my daughter's face couple of times while she was sleeping and she woke up screaming. The room smell funky when we first checked in - I could not figure out what it was until much later. There were ants everywhere - the bathroom, the vanity, and in beds - the only place I did not "see" them are on the carpet, which is in some very dark color. That was so gross to find ants in our beds and when my older one saw them, it took some effort to calm her. When I complained to the front desk, they sent an exterminator over in the middle of the afternoon when our two young daughters are napping. I had to sent them away. I am not sure if there is a safer way to address this before their guests are checked out. When we got home, we found ants in our lugguage! We paid a bit more for a 2010 renovated room - I could not figure out where the renovation was - everything looks rather old, e,g, the bathroom door does not close. The food quality from their Signature restaurant is quite poor so avoid it if you can. Having said all that, I must say that the indoor pool and the sprayground are definite fun place to be and the staff are friendly. My husband and I could not agree to whether this resort is worth coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: mrsqueen914
Reviews.Content: If you have a family with young children, this is the place to be! Our children are 4 and 7 and loved every moment of everyday that we spend! All of the water recreation was great! Especially the indoor pool, so much for the children to explore. The staff was friendly and ok, a lot of foreign employees. Some of them spoke little or broken english, which made it somewhat difficult to get answers when asked questions. The room that we had was very good. We stayed in the New York section which was remodeled. It has a full stove/range, fridge and they supply all the utensils, right down to the pots and pans! Just purchase food at one of the two markets near the resort to save lots of money, instead of going out to eat everyday - it becomes costly. Loved the shuttle bus to the boardwalk/beach, but FSK should supply additional buses to shorten the wait time, plus beachgoers have equipment which takes up space in the mini bus. The fitness center needs to be upgraded tremendously. Some of the equipment is rusty and some parts are broken. FSK only have one computer for the resort - should have at least 3 more. Overall, we love the resort and would diffinately recommend FSK to a friend. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “awsome it was great for everyone”
Reviews.Author: berdine14
Reviews.Content: they staff was great, room was perfect and there was somemuch to do there it is perfect for every one

Reviews.Title: “Been here many times, but this trip was just okay”
Reviews.Author: redfireflies
Reviews.Content: I was very much looking forward to my stay here this summer. Freshened up rooms, a new 50's diner.....which I couldn't wait to try. When we arrived, our room was ready even though we were a couple hours early. The rooms were decorated nicely, the grounds were clean. Went to the 50's diner our first day there. They specialize in build a burgers, so me and my husband ordered two cheeseburgers and my children choose the kids burgers. It took about 10-15 minutes there was only one other family in the restaurant. The waitress set the burger in front of me and there was blood all over my roll, needless to say I cut it open and it look like raw bloody hamburger inside. My husband choose to have his cooked longer but I choose not to eat it at all. Waitress said they cook all hamburgers medium.....fyi...my husband and I had a rare burger. I saw nothing on the menu that said they would be cooked to medium or I would have ordered it well done. One of the shuttle buses had no air conditioning, said temporarily out of service the whole time I was there .........I was there 6 days who knows how long it had been like that before I arrived. Heat index was around 100...15 people on board didn't make for a pleasant ride. So through in the towel with that. Then there's the beds. Some people love them others hate them and I am one of them. I weigh 135 pounds and sunk in it every night. The only thing that might bring me back to this hotel for another stay are the pools for the kids. They really enjoy them.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: user621
Reviews.Content: I stayed at FSK for three nights for work. I was working down at the harbor, and FSK is the closest place. My room was an efficiency with two double beds, dining table, large fridge, range, coffee maker, microwave, and sink. The kitchen seemed to be stocked with all your basics, as well as pot holder, dish rag, towel, and soap (I'm surprised how many efficiencies don't provide dish soap). The room had a flat screen TV on the standard long, low dresser. The bathroom itself had the toilet and full size bath. The sink was separate, in a partially divided section of the main room. One problem I had was that the tub and sink drained very slowly. The bed was comfortable but softer than my liking - I prefer a rather firm mattress. I didn't see it listed on their web site, but free wireless internet is available in your room - you just need a log-in and password from the front desk. The room was clean, and I had no qualms about walking around barefoot. Overall, the room seemed bright and "cheery". The property is much more open and less hectic than over in town. Parking seemed better as well. I didn't feel like they strunk the spaces to fit more cars. There is a diner in the main building where you can get breakfast starting at 7 AM, as well as burgers, shakes, and ice cream, I think unitl 9 PM. Elsewhere, there is a Starbucks and another diner next door, Carraba's and a Sunsations within walking distance, and an Outback, a pizza place, and a Japanese steak house across the highway in the White Marlin outlet mall. Down at the harbor, less than a mile away, is Crab Alley, Captain's Galley II, Harborside, The Shark, and Sunset Grill. A short distance down 50 is Hooper's Crab House. There is also a Food Lion and CVS nearby, and a gas station/convenience store across the street. Free shuttle buses runs continuously from FSK to the boardwalk (Somerset St.) from 9 AM to 10 PM in season. I think the shuttle bus would get you to the boardwalk faster than the town bus from some locations during the peak season. If you don't mind not staying within walking distance to the beach, FSK provides a relaxing stay near good food, with convenient access to the beach. I wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family motel”
Reviews.Author: hain1980
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation thanks to FSK motel. We have a 2 yr old child and FSK has some many amenities that help us met all our needs. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent family trip the best in ocean city and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: connieBaltimore
Reviews.Content: i have been going to ocean city for 28 years and i have to rely on who ever drives me there, and then wait until that someone wante to drive to the boardwalk. when i went to francis scott key last year because my friend recommended it i was extremily impressed with the shuttle because i dont drive and i could go to the boardwalk whenever i wanted and when the weather was nasty there is still so much to do there at fsk and you dont find that in any other hotel in o.c. I am constantly telling everyone i talk to about this wonderful place My two grandchildren had a blast. and so did this 61 year old Grandmother. i would like to know if you could tell me what window company did your windows on the outside iam getting ready to get new windows and was impressed with their work

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: twink8203
Reviews.Content: I read review after review and was really excited about staying at the FSK, and overall it was nice but just wasnt right for our family. Two adults, 9 yr old child. First when I arrived to check in, the girl at the desk was somewhat rude. I forgot my ID but had the credit card I used to book the room. With an attitude she explained the policy to check in. ( I dont mind the explanation or reminder but did not appreciate the belittling) After retrieving my phone to show her the confirmation email, again with an attitude she stated, "right here in the email it says what you needed to have." Onto the room, it was one of the remodeled rooms but still had slight stingy odor to it. AC was not on nor refrigerator as some hotels have ready when new guests are to check in. No curtains, just blinds. The beds were very uncomfortable, and they are double. So if you are taller then 6ft they are not right for you at all. Ideal for kids of course, which is what this place is about. Putt Putt is just small "greens." No obstacles, not fun, my daughter quit after six holes. The indoor pool is great. Very clean, always towels for use, warm water, fun environment. Only issues was a lifeguard that goofed off and flirted with the under age 18 girls in the hot tub (no one under 18 is allowed) Also a large group of adults that were allowed to take up much of the pool for a long time. My daughter and others were afraid to play and go down slide. The pool is pretty much set up for kids, and I felt this should not have been allowed. Maybe a seperate area/pool just for adults? Outside pool was clean, pool bar was nice. Playground nice. Shuttle bus service was perfect. Grounds are clean, could use signs on property to point you to pool, pond, buildings etc. To me its not really a family resort but a place specifically for younger children. I would recommend this to a family with younger children, 8 or less

Reviews.Title: “best hotel on east coast”
Reviews.Author: antpaul
Reviews.Content: this hoel is not like other hotels........ it has basketball,miniglof.playground, indoor and outdoor pool, water slide, and the kids can play manhunt,,,,,,, that way while i relax i know my kids are safe because there either playin manhunt or shooten the hoops or hitten the pool................ this is a very safe hotel with exelent room service and mouth watering food im coming here from june to july so my kid will be hittin the pool..

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for our next stay”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie3603
Reviews.Content: This will be our 4th year and it's the best.We come as a family with about 15 of us.And we truly have the time of our lives,just relaxing and letting everyone do what they want.We think it'sworth our time and money to drive from N.Y.Thanks so much we'll see you again in august. Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was really nice Iam planning on...”
Reviews.Author: donique
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice Iam planning on comeing back soon I really enjoyed myself and so did the kids the people were really nice,the staff, and also the people in the dinner so keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay If you Have a Boat & Young Children”
Reviews.Author: Eshleman22
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to FSK for 20 years now, every year, sometimes twice a year. The only reccommendation I have is that FSK comes up with some kind of system for people with boats. We have been getting our boat parked in every year or just about every year. We sometimes have to unhook our boat so that we can go away just with the vehicle and we come back to find that someone has parked our boat in so that we can not get to it and have to move it by hand. The woman manager was not the kindest person at first to deal with either. (May 28, 2010) Well at 11:30 at night, who is pleasant, I guess? Anyway, it is great for the kids, much to do with them and the boat clean up area is awesome. All in all, we love the place and have reccommended many, many people to it. (There should be some kind of discount for people like us) We sent 5 different families there in 1 year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry it took a year to write this”
Reviews.Author: geoffhaim
Reviews.Content: When my wife book this trip last year I was very skeptical as I remembered teh FSK as a mess when I grew up in the 70's...well not only did we have a great stay we booked a cabin before we left for this summer. If you have a fqamily and want a winner of a trip book at FSK. The kids loved the ammenities. My wife and I bought a tempurpedic matterss for our home and teh shuttle made the location perfect. See you in a few weeks. Geoff

Reviews.Title: “Thia place is AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: StranskyJ
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying with the Francis Scott Key for 15 years! First with our individual families (we were teenagers then) and now with our own children we have seen the changes over the years. they are always working to make it a better vacation for you and your family. My boys love it! we have never had any problems its always clean the staff always nice! thank you see you soon! The Stransky Family

Reviews.Title: “We Love LOVE LOVE this place!!”
Reviews.Author: RachelEason
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Francis Scott Key Resort last summer and had a blast!!! My son was 3 and nephews were 8! They have so much to do. And the shuttle to the beach is awesome! They are pretty strict on visitors which actually helps you have a better time. We did not have a single issue with the hotel, and the made even made little towel animals on out bed, which the children loved! This year we were planning our summer vacation to Disney World and my so said no he wanted to go back to the Pirate Ship!! So we are going back in July! The indoor pool was a blast, expecially at night time, and the spray park was a ton of fun! We will deff be comming back for many years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jennapens
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend vacation at the Francis Scott Key, and as always, we had a wonderful time. This was our second stay this year, and this time we were able to get an updated room. The new rooms are really nice and bright. My daughter loved the indoor pool and game room, and we enjoyed just walking the grounds. We were bummed that we missed the restaurant opening by a week, but we'll be back in September. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Our family would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: upstateNY88
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay with any age kids. There is alot of FREE things to do on the grounds.The pool was very nice, kids enjoyed it. Hot tub was enjoyable. No restaurant due to renovation, but that was ok. There were plenty of other places to choose from. Very close to everything, just a short drive over the bridge. Would make this my first choice when visiting OC,MD again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: pscott520
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the FSK! Great place to vacation with kids! Great indoor theme pool with slide, outdoor pirate ship splashground, minigolf...every employee we came in contact with was very polite and helpful. The shuttle service to the beach and boardwalk is great, you never have to wait more than a few minutes for a shuttle....its nice to be close to the beach but not right next to it...you avoid the noise and partying of staying near the boardwalk. The rooms were great, very clean, and you can't beat the Tempur Pedic mattresses.....will be even better this year with the renovations and new diner! Can't wait to come back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: staceykoz
Reviews.Content: We've been to FSK twice now and we're in LOVE with this place. Both times we went off season and my 4 year old son had a blast! We were looking for something to do to get away from the winter blast. The pool here is amazing! Loved all the neat extras like make your own snow cones, free movie rentals, free board games, a movie showing at night above the pool (only on weekends). The rooms aren't fancy, but they are clean and large. Love the closet area - very accommodating and the Tempurpedic beds are great. They even have flat screen tvs with HD - very nice surprise! The full kitchen units are nice if you are going for more than a few days. Its nice to be able to save money and cook there. We really love the fact that this motel is not right in the busy part of OC but is very conveniently located to the beginning of the boardwalk. During the summer months, they have a shuttle that will take you over. Overall, we won't stay anywhere else now when we go to Ocean City. Can't wait to go during the summer where we can use more of what FSK has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “great place for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: bluemoos
Reviews.Content: value was excellant and the place was clean needed some updating which was soon to be happining

Reviews.Title: “I was extremely impressed!”
Reviews.Author: mytwogoldens
Reviews.Content: We didn't have much money for a vacation last year so we picked this place because it had so many things for my 2 and 4 year old boys to do that did not require any more money and it was a short drive to the beaach if you didn't want to take the shuttle. The indoor pool had towles for you to use, all the areas are very clean and the other patorns were pretty nice. All in all, my family had a great time and are looking at coming back this year! You really don' t even have to leave the resort to enjoy yourself. One other thing is that you can not hear the other kids around when you are in your room trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: emtbrat51
Reviews.Content: The rescort was really nice and family orianted. The weekend kinda sucked because it rained that weekend, so some of the outdoors were off limits. But the indoor pool and serivce was great and very friendly. Very helpful with directions and questions. We are coming back for a family vacation in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “What they don't tell you...”
Reviews.Author: KahneGirl0909
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have both stayed at FSK various times over the last few years. We have two 4 year-old boys who love the indoor pool. We decided that it would be fun to take them Ocean City and stay the night there (as it is only an hour from where we live). We made the reservations for Wednesday, as that is the ONLY day of the week that works for both of us, only to arrive at FSK to be told that the pool is not open during the week. Why else would we stay there, otherwise in January, if not for the pool? & why would they not state on the internet that the pool is not open during the week, since it is their main attraction? The person at the desk refunded our money, even though she said she was reluctant to do so. We ended up staying at a hotel with a pool on the beach for cheaper (& the room was much nicer). I do not plan on staying at FSK, again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but deceptive.”
Reviews.Author: thisguyistoofly
Reviews.Content: It looked like a great deal on the internet, but a slight caveat to some travelers: it is not a resort. it is a MOTEL with a large indoor pool. the rooms were mediocre and outdated. it looks great for some familys, but go to one of the waterfront hotels in ocean city for a true resort experiance. O, and to the management: local tv/radio also advertised a "locals package", and that sounded kind of like a rent-by-the-hour thing when you hear it or see it.

Reviews.Title: “We did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: wm2266
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and had a wonderful time. The motel was very clean and the staff very friendly. The kids loved the indoor pool and the lifeguards were all great with the kids. We only live about two hours away and we are planning on going back - it was a great winter break! Looking forward to our next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Children loved it, bed was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: dmarsha123
Reviews.Content: We first stayed for one night in 08 and I thought the place was great for kids. I came back the next year with the freedom fighter special with the 1 year old and 2 1/2 year old. My kids love the pools. The indoor pool is a great option if its a rainy day. Hotel provides wings for the children which is great. The boat area is the best. I even have fun going down the slide with my children, who enjoy me doing so. The rooms were a little outdated but the extra comfy bed made up for it. I plan on coming back evey year until my little ones are tired of it. I for get the mention the shuttle that takes you to the beach and picks you up, this is a major plus. I would suggest maybe having a little activies for the children.

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: 4stack
Reviews.Content: well situated about 10 mins from beach by shuttle bus (very regular) across busy road from outlet centre. quiet resort ( it has a noise curfew at 11:00pm) good sized swimming pools one indoor one outdoor plus a splash area for young children. onsite restaurant was pricey but cheaper places a short walk away (applebees was very cheap with good food)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: BrookesTwins03
Reviews.Content: We returned home today from staying at the Francis Scott Key Family Resort and we're already making plans to return during our daughter's Christmas break. First and foremost, the rates are excellent! Very affordable for people like us who are on a budget. Second, the service was outstanding. All staff members were extremely polite and helpful. We were at the front desk a lot to take advantage of the free dvd's & game rentals and I'm sure my little ones where being annoying, but the staff smiled and engaged them with questions which really made the kids feel special. Third, the rooms were just as expected. Very clean and all appliances (tv w/ dvd player, heating system, hair dryer, iron, refrigerator, & lights) worked perfectly. The tempurpedic beds were super-comfortable. Fourth, the caribbean key indoor pool was AMAZING! My daughters (age 6) had a blast using the slides, playing volley ball, swimming and splashing. Mommy and daddy had fun on the slide too! At dark all the lights in the pool area were dimmed and we swam in just the glow of the pool lights. We also watched a movie while the kids played in the pool and Mommy & Daddy relaxed in the hot tub. The pool area, as well as the locker room was exceptionally clean and stocked with plenty of towels. We loved the showers in the locker room. Very family friendly. The lifegaurds were very attentive and very friendly. The only suggestion I have would be to request more floor mats to go around the pool, as the surface is very slippery. Both of my children slipped and were scraped up pretty badly. After that I made sure that they wore shoes when entering & exiting the pool area and there were no more slips. Fifth, make sure you take advantage of the playground area and putt-putt golf. These are both great activities to take up time while you're waiting for the pool to open. Lastly, you should be aware that there is ongoing construction in the lodge area, however the lobby was clean of debris. I can't say enough of the FSK family resort. We're looking forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: brighterday09
Reviews.Content: We loved every single thing about our stay ..it was awesome...we cooked on the grills every night and didn't have to go out to eat, we had a fire in the outside fire place, the pools were great, the bus made getting to the beach a breeze...have told everyone I can think of that this is the place to go....can't wait for next summer...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place for families!”
Reviews.Author: joe_n_laura
Reviews.Content: OK... the good: LOVED the indoor pool. My kids (21 months and 4 1/2 year old boys) could not get enough! They were nothing but waterwings sliding down the waterslide. It is so awesome to see them coming back from a day of playing and falling asleep before dinner. What parent doesn't love that? If I could change one thing about the indoor pool, I would have liked to have seen longer hours. There really isn't much to do with kids that wake up before 8AM. The rooms? OK.. you aren't staying at a fancy hotel. You have to understand that for the location and price, you have to sacrifice something. The rooms were clean but show their age. With that being said, the beds were awesome (tempur-pedic matresses), and the kitchenettes were very well stocked. Storage could be improved a little, and lighting can be improved a LOT, but for the cost, this is still a value. The breakfast is pretty sad. Honestly, it's pathetic. Do not expect this to be more than a snack before you get to a restaraunt, or maybe a treat for your children if they eat the cereal you were smart enough to pack. They also state to NOT bring trays, and there is a person who stands there almost daring you to break this rule. For a hotel that is so kid-friendly, one would assume that they would not be so worried about an extra min-donut sneaking out. I as a father am not going to drag my whole family down to the office building for this. This was a point that I found annoying, as I am sent back to my room almost juggling donuts and mini-muffins and dropping more than I am successfuly getting into my room. Last point was the hotel staff. We took advantage of the shuttle to take you to the boardwalk. While there, I bought my 4 year old a cheap $2 toy so he had something new. Well, as always happens, he lost it on the buss. As soon as we realized this, I went to the office to put out an APB on this toy. I never expected to see it again, and tried preparing a 4 year old for the news. Well, as we were in the indoor pool, a staff member hunted us down with this toy. I would love to know how he knew that it was my son who lost this jet, but he did. Did he have to go through that trouble when a message would have more than sufficed. Overall, this was a great stay, and our second visit. This will not be our last. We enjoy it so much that every time we go, we try extending our trip to no avail. Keep the great work up, and I hope that your prices stay reasonable. ONE suggestion; how about attaching the room keys to lanyards? Coming back from the pool would be so much easier if I didn't have to fish in a bag full of wet towels for my wallet that holds the room key. is this a feasable suggestion? Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “We have become unofficial spokespeople for the hotel after a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: LindaVan
Reviews.Content: I stumbled onto the Francis Scott Key website while searching for a place to stay for our first family trip to Ocean City, MD. Our first time in Ocean City and we plan to return to the FSK annually! The website promised lots of family fun and we were not disappointed in the least. Our days were filled with swimming and splashing, mini golf and sno-cones – and our nights with free movie rental, games and the Caribbean Key indoor pool! I had to drag the kids away to get to the boardwalk and beach – which were only a few minutes away by courtesy shuttle or a quick drive over the bridge. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the woman who cleaned our room wowed the kids each day by creating towel characters to match their own stuffed animals! The room was very clean and well maintained – and I am very particular about that. We stayed in an efficiency and saved time and money by cooking breakfast in the room and preparing sandwiches for lunch. There is a grocery store across the street so it all worked out well with a quick trip to the store on our first night. I could go on and on... and believe me my friends have heard it all... but we have recruited a lot of guests for next summer already just from our pictures and stories of our experience! Looking fwd to 2010!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok - resort”
Reviews.Author: akron
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Ocean City at the last minute and there was not much available for the Labor Day weekend. The room was basic. The carprt had a very large stain on the carpet. The pool outside was very cold and the indoor pool was dirty. There was large amounts of hair floating in the indoor pool and the floor around the pool was not much better.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rylan3
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to comment on the conditions of room 1712 on the dates of October 2 through 4. Upon check in, when we entered our room, the first thing that we noticed was an ant on the sink. I didn’t think much of it, so we proceeded to unpack and hit the pool. When we came back, we noticed about thirty ants where we just saw one previously. Immediately, we checked with housekeeping (luckily for us just happened to be going room to room) and expressed our concern. The comment we received was, “we thought we got all of them.” This was the most appalling problem, but wasn’t limited to the bucket of water under the A/C unit, the heater that smelled like it was on fire, or the rude person at the front desk who wouldn’t allow us to check out one day early in exchange for a ONE DAY refund. I will say that the pool area is very nice, along with very nice and friendly lifeguards. Unfortunately though, it was FSK’s only selling point. Keep this in mind when planning your next trip, because you can get much more for your money much closer to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Francis Scott Key--We will be back”
Reviews.Author: mulfNewYork
Reviews.Content: We met up with my sister and her son in Early August 2009. We had kids ages 15, 3, & 8. I absolutely loved the place. As stated in many reviews, the one problem I find with the rooms is the rust and old, yuck feel of the bathrooms, other than that it was great. I brought things with me like a can opener, a pitcher for iced tea ect, to find they had though of everything. We loved the splash area most I think, and the out door pool. Nobody really cared to go to the beach. The breakfast left much to be desired, and I am sooo glad to hear they are opening a new restaurant. It will do very well I predict, especially if they are planning to serve breakfast all day. Another comment I would like to make is that my husband became very sick on his stay and spend a lot of the time in bed. He was feeling better our last night, and I asked for extended check out and explained the reason. We had two rooms, and my sister called the next morning and they allowed us an extra hour, which was wonderful. We were able to play in the morning and still have a room to go back to change in comfortably before our 6 hr drive home. Thank You.. The only recommendation I have for families with teenagers (and only one of them--) Let them bring a friend. Because things close up by 9 or 10, and we had a little one also that would be totally exhausted and ready for bed, it was difficult for her to stay occupied (though the game rentals from up front are wonderful perk by the way) It seems the teenagers kind of hang on the playground at night and that is nice also. A safe place for them to be.

Reviews.Title: “Your kids will love it here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gelwicks76
Reviews.Content: We had a very good overall experience at the FSK motel...The pools were definitly a highlight, our children loved the pools. They did not even want to leave to go to the beach. The grounds were clean and well kept. The restaurant was very good although were glad to here that they will be putting a more family style restaurant. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially Louise, who was wonderful to us when we were booking!! The only minor complanit would be the rooms. Although they were clean, they are in need of a update. I read below that the rooms are set to be remodeled. Once this happens this motel be hard to top in ocean city,md. Let's put it this way ...we got back yesterday and my daughter already can't wait to come back next year.....

Reviews.Title: “Lucky with Leisure”
Reviews.Author: MernicMaryland
Reviews.Content: We all had a great time. This place is like staying with family, except without all the confusion.My 12 year old daughter and her friend just love it here. We are even thinking about coming back and having her 13th birthday party here. This is a very family oriented place. We just love staying here. This is always our all time favorite. It is definetly, without a doubt, a five star vacation!!!! Sincerely, Julie Demski

Reviews.Title: “What they Lack in quality of rooms, they truly make it up in guest services!”
Reviews.Author: jbaboo
Reviews.Content: I can tell you about the no great complimentary breakfast (did not come here for breakfast), I can tell you about the carpets (room 403), the noise of some young men on 9/4 labor day weekend in room 401...but all in all it was bearable, and it could happen in any other hotel, the showers a lil old, room a lil too old, but in all honesty were truly, sincerely and humbly satisfied with the courtesy service provided by the staff. The pools, the Pirate ship, the shuttle, the entire amenities are great! I am sure Mrs. Annemarie Dickerson is already aware of the problems, suggestions, but little by little you have a gem of an establishment that made my son cry because we where going home! my 4 yr old son did not wanted to leave! the service, the speed check-in process, the courtesy of using the facilities until 6pm the day of check-out...its commendable and it makes me want go back again and again! The shuttle driver was courteous (9/3 & 9/4 nite shift), the stop/pick up is at somerset st (1 block from boardwalk), the water facilties are great...parents please dont let the kids dive/slide head/arms first...there is an accident waiting to happen (one kid hit her chest against the wall of the slide at the pirate ship had problems breathing - parent never knew it happened!) but I honestly leave the main responsibility on the parents/guardians and not the lifeguards first. the temperpedic mattres is better than my expensive mattress at home!!! i miss the bed! the lil animal towels where something unexpected and really nice for my lil 4-yr old..you can have a "how to do it" workshop to highlight your staff's expertise. overall it was a great experience, close to the oc outlets, mall, boardwalk, food lion supermarket, CVS, dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, gas station, applebees-food, the assategui island, the best crab cake in town...the captain gavel, crab alley/house, race track for kids, liquor store, etc! (Phillips Seafood buffet its great, the doughboy roller pizza was the worst pizza ever! if you're from NY/NJ you know what i mean) We loved the OC experience, much in part because we stayed at the FSK Family Motel! Julian Buitrago Union, N.J. RM 403

Reviews.Title: “Simple Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kveliky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort 8/23-28 looking for an affordable family vacation. Room We had an end unit room in the Ohio building with a fully stocked kitchen. This allowed us to eat some meals in the room rather than in town or on the (overpriced) boardwalk. The room, although it was showing its age (beat up furniture, rusty shower head) was comfortable and clean. The cleaning woman, Anastasia, did a great job each day and my daughter was delighted with the towel animals. The Temperpedic Beds were amazing. Truly a luxury when staying in a motel. They even provided a pillow topper for the pull out sofa that my daughter used. I did have a complaint about the handle control on the shower. It was literally full of black mildew. Maintenance was to our room within a 1/2 an hour and replaced it with a new one right away. We also had a issue with the burners on the stove not working but this was also fixed for us. Pools The Pirate Spray Ground was adorable and a delight for the family. My daughter really loved seeing buckets of water getting dumped on our heads. The outdoor pool was basic. Plenty of seats, but there was some sand in the pool. I guess people didn't use the shower to rinse off before entering. There was a cash only bar owned by the restaurant. The indoor pool was great. It was one of the main reasons we chose this motel. We wanted to have a place to swim in case of bad weather. Unfortunately, our daughter was injured when a much older child playing volleyball next to the waterslide dove in front of the slide to get a ball. There was no rope or divider to keep the area clear at the bottom of the slide. We reported the incident and management seemed genuinely considered. I asked why there weren't rules posted by the slide and was told there's normally a lifeguard right at the bottom of the slide. (Apparently they were short staffed). We didn't go back to the indoor pool until the last day. There were two lifeguards but the chidlren were going down the slide in any position - headfirst, upside down etc. I asked the one lifeguard if the children should go head first or feet first and was" told they could go however they wanted as long as it wasn't on their knees." I told my daughter only to go feet first but noticed the lifeguard still wasn't really controlling the children on the slide. It made me nervous and I had my daughter move to the other end of the pool. It really is a great area - very cute, but after one accident - I didn't want to take any chances. Management told me they were going to close the pool for maintenence in a couple of weeks. I hope they take a few steps to make the area safer - post rules, tell the lifeguards to be more attentive because the indoor pool really is one of the best features of the hotel. Shuttle One van was broken during our stay so we didn't use the shuttle. Driving to and from the beach was no problem since there's plenty of free parking. If you go farther north the beach is narrower (better when trying to get to the water with a young child) and less crowded.
