The rip tides were rough, due to the hurricane out at sea, but thankfully there are plenty of lifeguards. Daily Activities There was supposed to be bead making, games, fishing, bingo and karaoke in the BBQ pavillion. When we got there we were the only family there. The girl running it said no one did karaoke but we could color or fish. The coloring books were all used up. She said she couldn't buy any more because there were a few pages still blank. My daughter did enjoy feeding the fish and the snapping turtle. We also went back the last day to play bingo. The girl running it even allowed my daughter to call the numbers since we were the only ones there. She was a nice, friendly employee. (Sorry, I don't remember her name.) The mini golf is also available as a small diversion. Nothing fancy, but convenient. Bascially, if you are at the resort and want entertainment, the pools or splashground is the place to be. One of the reasons we chose this resort was because managment read the reviews and commented on any negative posts. I was pleased with the managers who followed up with us to make sure our daughter was OK and that we didn't have any other problems with our room. This kind of customer service shows they really care about their guests. I undersand why the resort has families that return year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Texaslady178
Reviews.Content: I would definitely reccomend FSK to everyone.It is a family resort that has daily activities for families to participate it.My family and I have been guest at the hotel for the past 5 years and will continue to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid-unless you Really need a place for your kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: pastar52
Reviews.Content: The rooms are old,old old! Although the room was clean there was black crap on the ceiling in the bathroom.The lighting was extremely poor throughout and the shower had no water pressure at all! If you have small children you might go for this motel,but being in Trip Advisor's top 10 list is a joke! Also the walls are paper thin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: moniquea97
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in it was very quick which we loved. I had read some reviews on tripadvisor.com previously so we weren't surprised that the room was dark. Our room had a small hole in the wall and had some mold on the ceilings. The mattress was comfortable but the tv was too small. We accepted these things because we didn't come there to sleep and we knew that teh rooms were not going to be great. We requested towels while there and received them within 5 mintues of our call-that was really nice. Our child loved the indoor pool and the outdoor pirate water play area-this is what really made our trip. However, it rained Saturday (8/22/09) and we tried to go to the indoor pool we were told that it was closed due to the bad weather-rain, thunderstorms. When we asked why the INDOOR POOL would be closed because of this the staff just replied they had to close the pool. We were thoroughly disappointed. Not to mention there was another family behind us whose child started to cry along with ours because of this. If the indoor pool being closed is FSK policy then I think it's important that they put this in writing for their customers because this is the main reason why we chose this particular hotel. Had we known that the indoor pool was going to be affected by the weather we would have chosen to stay another weekend when we knew the weather conditions were going to be better. That incident made us feel like we wasted our money because we paid for amenities that we were not able to receive. Other rthan that little snafu it was a nice place to stay and the shuttle service was good although by Sunday morning only there was only 1 shuttle working which made our wait longer-wish they had a backup. Overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jralisea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought 2 11 year old girls and our 15 month old son.. Two pools and a water park always gave us something to do while we were at the resort. The girls loved all the pools. The 'quiet' policy was amazing having a baby in the room.. Overall- I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants a family oriented resort!! A+

Reviews.Title: “Great features and nice staff but a problem with the room”
Reviews.Author: jdiegjdieg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the FSK. We stayed in room 402 in the 400 building this weekend. There are some great things to say. The kids loved the indoor pool, but being advertised so much, it was too small for all of the people that come to it. The bus ride to the beach was great - not a lot of places offer that. But ... our room had ants. LOTS of them. We found them crawling all over the nightstand and beds and unfortunately in our food and drinks. We aren't complainers, so I admit that I didn't report it when I left, but that shouldn't stop them from fixing it - I'm talking LOTS. The maid has to have seen them. We may try this place again, though. Great location and still a lot of services for the money. Just take a look around when you first check in to make sure you want the room you're given! I saw some other reviews mentioning dirty/musty bathrooms. Ours wasn't great or new, but it was acceptable to me.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the family oriented theme..”
Reviews.Author: Pippizza
Reviews.Content: I would first like to start by saying that the resort was a nice sprawling acreage of pine trees, pools, and a small pond in the rear of the property. When we first arrived we approached a large front building which is the Main Lodge, that is where the front desk is located and we were greeted promptly and curteously, and given a packet to all the ammenities of the resort. Our room was located in the Ohio Building, that section has a kitchenette located in the room. The room was a bit dark, there was only one window which let in only a small amount of light in. In the back of the room was the kitchen and a seperate area for the bathroom sink and shower/tub combination. Everything was clean in our room and the decor was minimal and a bit dated as some people have mentioned but CLEAN! and thats important. Noise was a problem you could hear the neighbors on all sides especially the ones upstairs. Wireless internet was availabe in the room but it was in and out .The grounds were kept clean and patrolled by security. They have a shuttle that takes you to the beach, I thought that was pretty awesome! My son loved the Pirate Ship Spray Park it was a great ammenity for the kids and adults to cool off. The main pool was crowded on the hot days but you could always find a chair if needed. My only compalint about the pool was that it was filthy! It looked that it had not been cleaned since opening of the summer season, and I was a bit concerned with sanitary issues. I feel the owners could of put someone in charge of vacuming the pool each morning and maintaining the things floating around. There is no lifeguard at the pool so if you have kids like I do a watchful eye is necessary. There is also an indoor pool on the property which we only went to once, and that is all I needed. It was unruly and the lifeguards in there looked exhausted from all the chaos that ensued during the day. Given what I have said I truly liked the feel of the place it was very family friendly. The rates were awesome! I hope they keep it the way it is.There are some plans to upgrade but please don't overkill it with ammenities because it is a gem the way it is. What made this place so special for me is that it's a private resort situated off the beaten track, with a community feel that cannot be matched by any other resort in OC.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EVEN FOR YOUNG ADULTS !”
Reviews.Author: DjFacile
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 20's and we enjoyed our stay at FSK. The hotel is very clean, the staff is friendly and you can actually walk (25 minutes) to the beach. Fo rthe price, you can't get better in OC ! You actually don't need kids to enjoy it !

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmeyer826
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to your hotel for the past three years.. Your hotel has so much to offer for family's whith children.. Our children are 5 and 1 and they had a great time in the indoor and outdoor pools as well as playing mini golf and playing on the play ground.. This year we brought another family away with us and they also had a great time and can't wait to book our trip for next year.. We are looking forward to returning next summer with our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “If this place is in the Top 10, I'm afraid to see the bottom 10!”
Reviews.Author: CTJohn128
Reviews.Content: I guided my decision to stay here based upon the feedback of trip advisor reviewers. Boy was that a big mistake. I did not expect a 5 star resort, but I also did not expect the toilet to smell like a men's urinal at Yankee Stadium. The cleaning staff (and I use that term loosely) should be replaced. As other reviewers have mentioned, all of the fixtures have rust and the room just felt dirty. On the first day, I pulled a tissue from the box and out came a fly. The wireless Internet is spotty at best- better off not even having it unless the desire is to frustrate your customers even more. We were so disgusted that we left Thursday night, deciding to spend the overnight hours in our car rather than another night in that seedy room. I am sure management will post that the rooms and the wireless will be upgraded next year, but that is no consolation to me this year. I spent a lot of money for a "resort" experience and left feeling that I would have been better off pitching a tent nearby in the woods. The only positives out of the whole experience were the indoor pool, pirate ship spray station, and shuttle bus. Although, the price may sound nice, you are best spending a few extra dollars for quality!

Reviews.Title: “If your standards are very low, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: pfam
Reviews.Content: We arrived and our kids (6 and 3) were very excited to stay here after driving in right past the pirate ship sprinkler they were going nuts. We checked in, the staff was very friendly but once we got ot our room things went downhill. It was dark, damp and smelled moldly. I took off my shoes off out of habit and the carpet was wet. There was a used towel hanging in the bathroom behind the door, I guess housekeeping missed that one and the sink was very slow to drain. Without hesitation we knew we could not spend a whole week in there. It was like working as a camp counselor living in a wooden shack. We called the front desk and they told us that we could not get a refund. After asking to speak with a manager they relented and gave use back most of our money, but they insisted on keeping our deposit.. We took what we could get and will try to get back the rest through our CC company. We did not have a place to stay and it was 6 PM yet our room was bad enough that we drove off with 2 kids and no place to stay and scrammbled to find a more suitable room. Maybe some of the rooms have been updated, ours certainly wasn't. We found a hotel room on the boardwalk for a bit more money and our kids never asked about or missed the kid pool and sprinklers.

Reviews.Title: “Nana, Tyler, Kenny & Gaje”
Reviews.Author: Flinana
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at The Francis Scott Key Resort. And I must say my grandsons (3) and I had a wonderful time. All 3 entered in the golf tournament everyday. The 13 & 5 yr old won 1st and 3rd place. The 5 yr old loved the pirate ship and normally he doesn't jump in with other kids, but the pirate ship brought him out of his shell. The indoor pool was the favorite of the other 2 boys. We fished and played board games, watched movies. We all enjoyed ourselves, and my boys expressed returning to this resort. In the pass we went south to the beach, but this year I wanted something closer to DC since I was the only adult. 2 1/2 hours from home, I loved it. Thanks again, I met some really nice people as well. Everyone was friendly and helpful. See you again in the furture.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: jm2009Pa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay with a 12 and 13 year old. We found it to be clean and the staff was friendly. The kids enjoyed the mini golf and volleyball at the indoor pool. The shuttle service was GREAT! We never waited longer than a couple of minutes and usually the bus was waiting for us. I would recommend anyone to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here over and over again”
Reviews.Author: Cleggclan
Reviews.Content: We love the amentities they offer, the indoor pool, outdoor pool, the activites are family friendly, the new splash park is great for kids. They have horseshoes/volleyball/basketball and a pool bar for the adults to enjoy. The rooms are comfortable, wish they would offer a queen size bed. We stayed in a cabin on 1 of our stays, very comfortable with a kitchen. The staff is always helpful and friendly. You really can't beat the price for all they that they offer. We keep coming back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent stay and would return again!”
Reviews.Author: spinchickNJ
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank everyone for their previous reviews as I relied heavily upon other reviews when making my decsion. I was also impressed that management addressed reviews that were less than positive which tells me they care and strive for improvement. We just retuned from a 5 day stay August 2-8. We had a very positive experience and my young kids (ages 3 and 5) loved the Pirate Ship Splash area and indoor pool. We stayed in the New York building (full kitchen) and found the room to be clean and it met our needs. I do agree with some previous reviews that the rooms are very dark but I see that 92 rooms are slated for redecoration (new carpet and lighter color bedspreads) next year and I think that will be a huge plus. While the exterior of some of the buildings are showing their age I found the grounds to be well maintained and everything seemed quite clean and tended to in regards to landscaping. The shuttle was a nice convenience. Only one night could I hear some loud guests returning to their room and I guess it is luck of the draw who your neighbors may be but I would not hold that against the hotel they do have a zero tolerence policy for noise after 11pm and each guest initials and acknowledges this policy upon check-in. Unfortunately there are just some inconsiderate people out there at times but that is the minority. I also found the staff I encountered to be very pleasant and that includes the front desk, life guards, maid, and shuttle driver. I was sitting in the lobby using their free computer to research dinner options and the front desk was enthusiatic and pleasant to everyone checking in and checking out. I chatted with the front desk staff on dinner recommendations and borrowed games and moviews throughout my stay. I even overheard a phone conversation where someone had to postpone their trip due to surgery (not sure if that was really true or an excuse) but the front desk was quite gracious and offered a credit to stay at another time. I would defintely return with my family again and would encourage anyone who is looking for a good value and family friendly location to consider this hotel. If all the improvements mentioned by management come to fruition I think people will find it difficult to find any fault. I do have two very minor recommendations for improvement but are not in anyway a detraction from the hotel. 1)wi-fi needs to be improved as I could not access from my room and had to go to the main lodge and even then service was slow. 2) Please consider offering towels at the outdoor pool and Pirate Splash Park not just the indoor pool. If you are thinking about staying at this hotel I would go for it and give it a try. By reading all the reviews I think my expectations were reasonable and I was not at all disappointed or surprised in any way. My kids LOVED it and cried when it was time to leave and we had a clean room. It was a successful trip in my eyes and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: sharibrat
Reviews.Content: After reading great reviews on this motel, I decided to book our mini-vacation here. I was a bit reluctant to go with a motel and also one a mile from the beach. We have stayed in some pretty fancy hotels over the past few years, so I was worried about this a little bit ;) I was pleasantly surprised! Yes, the rooms are somewhat dated and yes, the walls are thin. But you know that by reading these reviews. Most importantly, it was clean. The beds were comfy and the room was clean. When we go on vacation, our intent is not to spend time in the room--we just shower and sleep there. It was nice to have a separate sink and mirror area from the shower/toilet. We always travel with a white noise machine to help drown out noise so our kids could sleep. We could hear very loud 'thumping' above us until 10:30 or 11 at night (probably a small kid like our own!) but then it stopped. THere is a quiet time which begins at 11. Housekeeping was pleasant and the kids loved the towel animals. The grounds were kept just fine. It was not an immaculate island resort (nor did I expect it to be), but it was maintained just fine. The resort has so much for families to do - games and contests each day, pirate splash zone, indoor and outdoor pool, volleyball net, kids park, mini golf......what other hotel gives you all those options? The indoor pool was so much fun for our kids. I loved that most of the pool was 1, 2 or 3 feet. The kids loved that they could 'go out so far' and still be able to stand. The pirate splash ship was also loads of fun for them. Some of the larger kids were really slamming into the base of the slides, so I would caution older kids on that. But for the youngest, it was great. I also felt the lifeguards were very attentive. The shuttle bus was very convenient. We never had to wait very long for it to arrive and the driver was always helpful with loading and unloading beach bags, strollers, etc. What a nice amenity to offer. I would definitely recommend this motel to families. The hotel also allowed us to use the grounds (pool, shuttle, locker area, etc) prior to check in and also after check out. We were able to enjoy full days on both our arrival and departure day. It was really nice to be able to shower at the pool before heading home! Oh and how could I forget? The restaurant on site was FABULOUS. Best meal we had in OC.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SUMMER VACATION EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghNursey01
Reviews.Content: Awesome!!! is how I need to start this review. My sister had been down to OC 2 wks prior to me and my family arriving to FSK. She told me to book a hotel on the boardwalk somewhere,I'm glad I didnt listen to her! I started surfing the internet and found the FSK resort. Thank God!! To start the check in was quick and easy w/ no lines,the rm was clean and cool -wish I would of booked a rm. w/ a full kitchen , we had a small frig ,but made use of it. To save from eating out get a rm w/ full kitchen preferably on the Florida side since its the newest building and the indoor pool is connected to it. I know that for next yr. Next ,all the amenities were just awesome 2 pools,a spray area for the kids to run and slide was great .The pool had a bar and hot tub along w/ a baby pool also.Put put golf right next to the pool area, all kinds of activites for the kids thru out the day. Nice clean picnic pavillion area to grill out at. Fishing in the pond that the kids enjoyed - rods and bait included.Basketball and volleyball at the resort along w/ a nice sized playground area. Not to forget about the indoor pool that was only 4ft all around, which is great for the younger kids - there is also a slide here too.A drop dwn movie screen that shows movies every evening- wasnt the best only because kids are running around and playing and the movie cant be heard -but we didnt mind.There is also a fitness rm, arcade, and laundry facility located in the building w/ the indoor pool which is the Florida unit.The shuttle arrives frequently all day til 10pm, we never had to drive,and we never waited longer than 5-10min to get picked up or dropped off.We went to the beach 2 of our 4 days in OC, honestly we never really had to leave the resort. My kids had soooo much fun ,we cant wait to come back next yr tostay 7 days this time. All the families we met have been coming to FSK for several yrs now.The price was very reasonable for families on a budget trying to save and have a nice time.We enjoyed every day at the FSK resort and cant wait to return!! If somebody is reading this and still uncertain about planning their trip,PLS DONT HESITATE make your reservation NOW.You will not be disappointed.I cant express it enough how nice and clean this place is. Its also well lit at night and security does walk the premises. All the amenities are in walking distance from each other.No real reason to leave the resort - except to get some sand and catch a wave!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year at FSK and it didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jlavetan
Reviews.Content: This is the second year our family (with kids ages 5 and 2) stayed at the Francis Scott Key. Everything was top-notch. The one complaint I had was with our room. We stayed in one of the Ranch buildings near the front of the property. There was absolutely no place to hang up wet bathing suits, beach towels, etc. to dry. It would have been nice to have a clothes line in the bathtub, a railing outside, etc. to hang up wet items. We found ourselves hanging things all over the room to dry them. Other then that, the kids enjoyed the indoor pool and the pirate sprayground. Looking forward to coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't count on a good night's rest - walls are paper thin”
Reviews.Author: TravelMomof3MI
Reviews.Content: The Good The hotel is great for young children. My kids loved the pirate splash area and the indoor pool. The minature golf wasn't much but the kids loved it. They also liked the playset. The rooms are roomy and even had a balcony so my husband and I could stay up while the kids slept. The hotel does try to impress, fancy animal shaped towels, and such. The shuttle bus was very dependable when we took it. The Bad The rooms are dated and the walls are paper thin. I suppose the hotel would have been just about perfect if it wasn't for that. Your experience staying at the hotel probably depends on what type of neighbors you have. Our neighbors came in late around 12:30 AM in the morning and would stay up to 4AM in the morning with the tv on. I really couldn't tell if the tv was on too loud or it was just the walls. I finally called to complain the third night of the trip and I was told that yes the walls are very thin. The hotel however took no action on my complaint. You can even hear your neighbors conversations during the day. My kids slept through all the noise but my husband and I were waken every night of our stay. The breakfast bar wasn't much and there was a sign saying to only take food for yourself which wasn't very convenient with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing ,family oriented vacation location south of the border.”
Reviews.Author: UWaterloo
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a 2 month old and 7 year old for our summer vacation and stayed at the FSK. The third year in a row.Seasonal staff are students from Romania,always super friendly and go the extra mile in keeping children amused.(animals and birds made of towels folded in the rooms a real pleaser) .There are plenty of kid based activities ,treasure hunts,fishing derbies,bingo.Cardboard boat races and movie nights in the pools are a hit. Shuttle buses to the beach are extreamely clean and always on time.Entire motel extreamely clean and well kept up.We will be arriving again this month for another well earned and looked for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: QueensMarine
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just spent a 7 days at the Francis Scott Key Resort during the fourth of July week. I have twin boys, age nine, and they had a great time. Their are many activities at the resort for them, they especially liked the fishing tournament that took place by a small pond at the property and a card board box race that took place at the outdoor pool.. The two pools and sprayground were also a great hit. This place is ideal for families with small children. The shuttle bus was also great. It traveled to and from the Ocean City Boardwalk (one stop at Somerset St.) until 10pm and we never had to wait more then five minutes for it. I would have given this place a rating of five but didnt due to some room for improvements. FSK supplies very little in the breakfast area especially in the way of healthy items (they only have some mini donuts and muffins), it is better then nothing but a expanded breakfast area where families can sit would be nice. The rooms also seem a little old (wood paneling, older tube TV's) but are kept very clean. The wireless internet is almost useless. I tried to use t many times but it is way to slow and you usually get timed out before connecting to any websites you are trying to reach, luckily they had one in the lobby that was not heavily used. The staff at the key was very helpful and friendly. We had one problem with very loud neighbors who were cursing and swearing out loud at their children in front of their rooms. When I mentioned this to the front desk they immediatly changed my room with no further questiions. I will definitley come her again and have already recommended this place to some of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “ocean city Md. best keept secret”
Reviews.Author: BearDeBeachbum
Reviews.Content: The best way i can start this review is just to say wow!!!! To say my family and i were blown away with the Francis Scott key resort would be a understatement. My family and i have been vacationing in OC MD. for 9 years now we have loved every trip, but this one will stay fresh in our memories for some time to come. Friends of ours told us about the FSK resort the same ones who told us how much better that OC MD. was better than the jersey shore , well lets just say they weren't wrong about OC MD. and they certainly weren't wrong about the FSK resort. I am A father of four at various ages , my son is 18 and i have three daughters 14, 7 and 3 as you can imagine it is hard to keep 4 kids with such a stretch in ages happy and content on vacation. Well at the FSK it wasn't ,first let me say from the minute we got on the property we were greeted with cheery courteous staff. we checked in and got our folder with everything you needed to know about the hotel a schedule of activities for the resort as well as everything that was going on all over town. WE then proceeded to our room which was a 6 person room with the kitchenette . The room was spacious and very clean the appliances were new and also very clean as well the kitchen had everything you needed to cook with . which when you have a big family is a great option that you have at the FSK to save money. they also have a wonderful picnic pavilion complete with grills that family's can use on a first come first serve basis to barbecue. Now lets get to the fun stuff the FSK offers a wide array of fun organized activities from 10am till 7pm if your looking to just stay and hang around the resort and RELAX as we did during our week long stay , quite frankly it was a battle to get my kids to go to the beach cause they were having so much fun at the resort. my 3 year old favorite things were the spray ground and the tricycle races and cant forget the snow cones my 7 year old loved the Caribbean key pool and just about any activity she could get involved in and cant forget about the snow cones. I also have to give a lot of credit to the life guards as well as the activities girls they were awesome with my kids. Now on to my teenagers they bounced around to all the pools there are so many family's at the FSK it is very easy for the teens to make friends , there is a basketball court on site a sand volleyball court as well as a very challenging mini golf course on site, and if they got board with all that they took advantage of the free dvd rental or before they spent all there money and a lot of mine the hoped on the free shuttle that runs continuously from 9am till 10pm to the board walk and beach .The shuttle was an incredible amenity i drove my truck once the whole time we were there we used the shuttle all week which saved us a ton in gas and parking fees the only time we had to drive some where was to go to the free events sponsored by the town of OC which they have schedules posted on the info boards, the movies on the beach and family Olympics are a blast. Well if you couldn't tell by all of this my family and i had a blast the time we spent at the FSK . The only mistake we made we brought to much stuff as we were used to renting condos were you have to supply all your own linens and towels . At the FSK there is daily housekeeping service the clean up the room fresh towels every day and make the beds , which reminds me very rarely are hotel beds more comfortable then the one you have at home now i have my wife pricing out posturpedic mattresses They even have towels for you at the indoor pool , the only place you need your own towels is the outdoor pools and at the beach. THE BOTTOM LINE IS MY ENTIRE FAMILY IS COUNTING THE DAYS TILL WE CAN GO BACK AGAIN TO THE FSK WHERE THERE IS FUN AND RELAXATION FOR THE ENTIRE FAMILY

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved it! But...”
Reviews.Author: lilnessaluv
Reviews.Content: We loved the convenience and family-themed atmosphere of the FSK. We had one of the balcony rooms that overlooked the pirate splashground! However, at the time of our stay our son was hurt on the slide of the pirate playground and was badly burned on his side by the concrete. I see now that they have fixed that problem with the slides....which was quick and awesome! Other than we had a blast and the staff was very friendly and it was amazing how there was something for all of us to do and we never got bored of the pools !

Reviews.Title: “We love the Francis Scott Key and return several times a year.”
Reviews.Author: karenconnolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first started staying at the Francis Scott Key last year due to the many amenities for the kids but we quickly started coming back several times a year due to the friendly staff and great service. Every day, there is something new to do whether it be a put-put contest, water games, board games, etc. There is always something to do at the Francis Scott Key. It is directly across the street from the Outlets so you can shop, or hop on the shuttle that rides every 15 minutes from 9am-10pm to the ocean. It is a great location and a wonderful hotel. We encourage everyone to come give it a try. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “this place is incredible”
Reviews.Author: shanstrs
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to bring a family. The facility is clean. the people are amazing. There are so many things to do there is no reason to leave and go in town. The indoor pool is amazing. The pirate ship is hours of fun. The shuttle is awesome. the longest i waited was less than 5 minutes. I can't say enough good things about this place. I will continue to take my family there for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: popnnfresh
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to OC after years at Myrtle Beach. I am very glad we chose to stay at FSK after reading the reviews and agree wholeheartedly with the positives mentioned: great value, quiet and clean resort, super shuttle service, and very nice indoor pool (my 8 yr old and 1 and half year old were there every evening and did not want to leave!) and for us, a super location away from the bustling boardwalk. We had a great time staying here and will definitely be back in the future. Thanks for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: PaOCVacationer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from FSK and thought it was a great deal. We have a 4 year old and a 4 month old and were not sure what to expect as this was the first time staying at FSK. Our 4 year old loved the resort. He could have stayed at the indoor pool the entire time we were there. Unfortunately, the Ohio Building does not seem to have sound proof walls. We could hear our neighbors both upstairs and beside us all the time. It got to the point that our 4 month old would wake up from the neighbor's noise not his 4 year old brother's noise. Also, the breakfast was pretty cheap and we were not offered trays to take back to the room for the coffee and tea we so desparately needed to wake up from the noisy neighbors. BUT we thought overall the resort was PERFECT for our family and we would stay again but in a cabin.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: TheFetzerFour
Reviews.Content: We booked rooms at the Francis Scott Key Family Resort after reading the impressive reviews on TripAdvisor, and we are so glad we did! The resort sits right on Ocean Gateway, just a mile from the hustle-and-bustle of the Boardwalk, but it feels like a campground in the middle of the woods! It's cozy and quiet and spans more than 13 acres! We stayed in the lodge with a room facing Ocean Gateway. Amazingly, we heard absolutely no street noise at all. We were never bothered by the noise of guests in nearby rooms -- we couldn't even hear other showers running, which is usually a real annoyance. The activities for kids (and adults) are fabulous -- we took advantage of just about everything. Perhaps the best feature of this hotel is the shuttle. We went from hotel to Boardwalk in just minutes and could come and go as we pleased all day long! No traffic, no driving, just a relaxing jaunt with friendly, helpful bus drivers. The housekeeping staff filled our room with towels folded into animal shapes. The entire staff was exceptional. We will stay here on our next trip to OC, and we highly recommend FSK to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shuttle bus great, plenty to do on site.”
Reviews.Author: brentd01
Reviews.Content: traveled with softball team. the shuttle bus was great for girls to go to beach. Bad weather they played in indoor pool. the girls played volley ball at the court. I think they had to much fun, didn't do to well at softball.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: outdrfun
Reviews.Content: We chose the FSK motel based on other reviews and we were not disappointed! The beds are very comfortable, the staff is friendly and available, the shuttle is great, the indoor pool was perfect for not so sunny days, and the mini golf, our night fun! Our room was a bit dark but it did not bother us so much. The location is great for people who want quiet time after a day at the beach and/or the buzzing of the boardwalk... After 7 days, our children didn't want to leave! We will be back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: toodlelu
Reviews.Content: We chose FSK after a recommendation from a former co-worker. It figured that we picked the hottest week of the year to visit. I didn't know what to expect, but I was exceptionally pleased! When we didn't utilize the hourly shuttle to the boardwalk, we were dozing by the indoor pool. My daughter didn't want to get out! The rooms were clean, the staff were very helpful. Checking in and out was a breeze. Will I go again? I just booked my reservation! My daughter just requested to "go to the place that has that neat waterslide." My pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “A great 13th birthday stay!”
Reviews.Author: cmd72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in April. The hotel was busy because they were running a special package. Regardless of how busy they were, we got great service. It was myself and 3 "13 year olds", not easy to please. They however loved it! They used the indoor waterpark, played minature gold, and volleyball. All this was included in our stay. There is plenty to do and in some ways it isnt even necessary to spend lots of time at the boardwalk with so much other stuff to do. Our room was very clean and plenty big enough. It is a bit dated but fine. Bed was nice and comfy! The front desk was very friendly and helpful. I was looking for something to read, such as a newspaper, so I asked at the front desk and she showed me an entire bookcase full of reading material that I could borrow during my stay. The visit was wonderful. Of course the inlet is a small drive away, being the only thing that for some could be a concern. We took our car to the inlet parking lot and had no problem. I will use the shuttle service in July when I return for my second visit. A great value and a great place.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Could not have ask for anything better. Will be comming back”
Reviews.Author: melstree
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, The rates are great, everything you need is right there, People are so friendly,[ GREAT PLACE FOR CHILDREN ] They make you feel at home, Your personal belongings are safe. If you have a expensive car, or moter cycle, You don't have to worry about it on the lot. All these things mean a lot. Trust me you have to check this place out. You can't go wrong Thank you Sincerely Sharon Boyles Pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “So great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: traydiggs
Reviews.Content: The rooms at FSK are not the best. They are older, but most have been recently renovated. They are quite dark, also. Having said that, this is a motel at the beach and I have found that even the higher priced hotels along the ocean aren't all that nice. We stayed June '08 for 3 nights and had a blast. Our 6 year old loved the pools (there is one outdoor, one indoor) and the Pirate Sprayground provided her with hours of fun! We also took advantage of our free game of mini golf that was offered. One night, after returning from the boardwalk, we borrowed a board game from the lobby. The free shuttle was the greatest thing! No looking for parking at the beach! It also forced us to scale down the amount of things we were bringing to the beach - yeah! We really had a fantastic trip and are looking forward to our second stay next month! I really recommend this motel for families. There is so much to do. Just keep in mind that the rooms are slightly dingy...not dirty, just older.

Reviews.Title: “More Fun at FSK....”
Reviews.Author: Krislynell
Reviews.Content: We usually visit the FSK for a weekend in February for the kids to enjoy the indoor pool, but this time we took a spur of the moment weekend vacation with our kids and friends this past weekend at the FSK. As always, the front desk girls (and Ben) were very helpfull and pleasant. We were to stay in a cottage, and the first cottage had a non-working air conditioner, so we were moved to the next door one which was bigger. We had a few issues but the maintance men were very quick to respond and very quick to help. I havent had the pleasure of dealing with maintance men that were so quick before, so that was great. Over all, the weekend was great....nice place, great pool for the kids, the life guards were very quick to help when my daughter got a scrape, over all, great staff and great place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel minus my circumstances”
Reviews.Author: beach_fever_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son this past weekend. I think the general idea of the hotel is nice, but there were some drawbacks for me. I will say that my room was available to me earlier than the promised check in time. When I got to the hotel, everyone was very friendly, they offered a lot of information about their services and amenities and gave me a folder with general information. My problem is that I have to carry my son up 2 flights of steps, along with all of our stuff. No one offered any assistance for either the way up or down. After 2 trips on the way up, I finally had to ask someone for help because I had had too much. Another issue I had which was no fault of the hotel. I accidentally left my new shirt in the bathroom at the indoor pool. I guess about a 1/2 hour later I figured out that it was missing, and someone had stole it. The next day I went to the pool again, and there was a little confrontation between me and some rude guests that were staying there. The only other thing that I can think of is that the shuttle wasnt running as I had been told it would. I read some other reviews on here that said the water was strange. I didnt notice anything wrong with the water-seemed fine to me. I think the indoor pool is a very nice thing if you have kids. They all seem to be having a lot of fun! The location can be a bit of an annoyance but I know that in the summer it will be good to be somewhere that has a family quiet time policy.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions”
Reviews.Author: lulabe11
Reviews.Content: There is some serious room for improvement with the customer service folks handling the reservation line. I have never stayed here but I am trying to obtain information to book a first time visit this summer; yet, I am rushed off the phone every time I call (3 times, 3 different reps; there will not be a 4th) Given the economy, it is cruicial to provide exceptional customer service if you are to remain viable. I hung up wondering if there was some fine print that stated a "no more than 2 questions allowed per call" This stuff matters to people.

Reviews.Title: “It's cool...but what's with the shower water?!”
Reviews.Author: MikePhilly
Reviews.Content: I'll just get this out of the way right off the top: What is with the water in this place? All I could think of was Wesson cooking oil coming out of the showerhead. It actually made me slippery! It even made the tub slippery! I'm not crazy: My boyfriend said the same thing. And my aunt & uncle were staying in a room in another building and they said the same thing. (They've actually stayed at the FSK before and they said the water was also like that during their first stay.) It is very bizarre because you don't feel like you're getting clean. And it doesn't matter how long you stand under the water rubbing yourself: It doesn't ever get NOT slippery! Also, I'm not sure who those guys were in the next room but there were a LOT of them. And they had a bunch of big trucks parked outside. They were up both mornings before the crack of dawn and were very, very noisy. Both mornings (we're talking, like 4:00 a.m.), they flung their front door open and a bunch of them kept coming outside, talking loudly and smoking right next to our door and window! The cigarette smoke was coming right into our room. And there was no getting back to sleep because they wouldn't shut up and they were banging around in the room. This isn't really a management problem except that maybe they could do a better job of not letting groups of 10 people sneak into one room. (How though?) The room was dark and old-fashioned but had incredible amenities. The kitchen cabinets were fully stocked with everything you could need to prepare a meal and entertain right there in the room! The beds were apparently Tempur-Pedics and were amazingly comfortable. The front desk people were super-nice and because we purchased a package, we got a beach bucket (& shovel) in which we found all kinds of great gift certificates for area shopping & dining. Very cool! All in all, we had a bad experience but I can't really blame it on management. If we were in a different room (or if the guys next door were in a different room), I'd have been very pleased. I would stay again and I would recommend it to others--but I'd be sure to mention that cooking-oil-as-water situation. Otherwise, the place is actually pretty awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of dumpy motel, hard to get crib, wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: VATravelFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 1-year-old in October because we had read such positive reviews on this site. The "family resort" is really just your average motel with a fun pool. There wasn't anything particularly special about the accommodations, and it was actually quite difficult for us to get a crib for our baby (not very family friendly). I had called the front desk before our stay to inquire about the type and availability of cribs. I was told it wouldn't be a problem to get one and that they had Graco brand Pack 'n Play cribs. When we checked in I was told we could not have a crib in our room (a 6-person room but there were only 3 of us) because it was against fire codes. After asking to speak to a manager they eventually conceded that we could have the crib because we didn't have 6 people sleeping in the room. The staff then began looking for an available crib which seemed difficult. The eventually found a rickety metal crib (not the brand and type they had claimed to provide). The "Caribbean Key" sounds nicer than it is, but I could understand kids enjoying it. It's an indoor pool with a Caribbean/pirate theme and play equipment that pours/sprays water around. There are a couple slides and play rafts to float on. The included breakfast was surprisingly nice and they didn't mind that we were taking the meal back to our room to eat. We were in town during an antique car show so it was quite load with old cars and motorcycles revving their engines late at night. Between that, the crib situation, and the marginally clean and run down room, I would not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful memories”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover037
Reviews.Content: We started staying at the Francis Scott Key 50 years ago. We lived in Crofton, Maryland. It was so convenient to go to the Ocean. Staying there was more quiet at night, but so close to the Ocean. The FSK had all antiques. They served dinner each night in the Dining Room. I am now widowed, but for many years, my husband and two daughters had such fond memories of our stays. About 40 years ago, they sold all of the antiques, and a couple bought the Resort. They no longer ran the restrurant, but the service was wonderful. My family was chosen to be put on the brouchure for the Resort. Nice, Nice memories.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and rude”
Reviews.Author: ocman123
Reviews.Content: We had family stay at the hotel ans we were invited to the pool. We had cards to the pool, which were sold by the FSK. It seems they dont honor those cards any longer. What a scam, sell cards and dont honor them. The person at the desk was very rude to my mother and her grand daughter. We have been living here for over 30 years and had alway told out of town friends to stay there, never agin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: nbalakers10
Reviews.Content: Tween Reviewer: Omg, what can I say about this hotel. The rooms have great setup, like pans big enough to cook a small lobster. WARNING: do not eat at the Italian restaurant Salvatore that is down the road from the hotel bleak nasty. It was really cold outside, and we went to the pool area. They heated the water, but the trip down from the hotel room was a mess we were all freezing cold, but with the water it was hot and the people were very nice to us. But there always is a down side to everything, so the hotel rooms were kind of small. I heard that the restaurant connected to the hotel is so good. The beds are made of surprisingly tempur-pedic mattress but I had to sleep on the fold out chair but the chair had a cover of foam and it was comfortable, because my baby sister and my mom slept on one bed, and my dad and my brother slept on the other bed and no more room 4 me. The staff was very kind to all of us. The motel does not look as cool as it really is but overall it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Francis Scott Key Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: OCMDfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at FSK last August and were a little worried because we never stayed there before. It was a great experience. It was clean, comfortable and roomy. It is not a five star resort but you are not paying for a five star resort either. My children 11, 16 and 2 had a great time, My son (2) absolutley loved the minigolf and the indoor pool. My girls loved the freedom of the indoor pool. My 16 year old was very disappointed with the policy that no children under 18 can get in the hot tubs. I think maybe that should be reviewed and maybe make them be 16 and older with a parent...just a thought. Our air conditioner did not have a cover and we called the desk about it. They came immediately and replaced it. The man who took care of it was very friendly and helpful. We had so much room for all of out stuff it was great. We normally stay on the boardwalk but decided to give this a try since we have the 2 year old. We loved it and we are going back this August.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, especially off-season!”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 5 nights on business and pleasure. I was not sure of it because it was such a huge complex and that it was deemed a family resort. But, since I was going off-season, the nose levels should be fine and they were. This is a massive complex with a wide variety of rooms. I was booked in the Pennsylvania Building with two double beds. The place looks a bit old, but it is well worth it. I payed only $43+tax per night. I found out on check-in that all the mattresses in every room were Tempur-Pedic. Wow, these were really comfortable and after sleeping 5 nights on them, I barely got any sleep the first night I returned to my own bed. This is a nice place, not busy during off-season and very quiet. I am not sure I would like it during the summer months, probably too many kids running rampant around the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Currin1019
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two small children. The weather was not great when we were on vacation so I was incredibly thankful to have picked a place to stay where there are a lot of on-site activities for the family. The gym and indoor pool/ game area were put to good use when the rains came. Our vacation was not "ruined" by rain or cooler-than-normal weather. Everyone had a great time. The room was small but clean. The housekeeping staff was very good and personable too.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: bluejay24
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our OCMD vacation. This was my family's first time in Ocean City and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. I was a little concerned at first that my kids would be too old to fully enjoy this hotel, but they sure proved me wrong. We stayed in a room with a kitchenette and it was great. The beds were comfortable and the room looked better than the pictures on the website. The staff was nice, especially the front desk and bartender at the pool bar. The beach and boradwalk are a short 5 minute drive away on the beach shuttle and we enjoyed the mall and go carts right across the street. We've already made plans to return next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Alot of Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Tarris
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed one night this past weekend. It was a really neat place. The splash ground is really cool...my kids LOVED it. We also had a great time at the indoor pool playing volleyball. The complex just has soooo much for the family to do...game room, ping pong, foosball, 3 places to "play" in the water, putt-putt. The shuttle to the beach was great too! The people who work there are FANTASTIC. They were all so nice. And the life guard on duty at the indoor pool on Sunday morning was so sweet! One of my sons tripped and scraped his knee. He was really crying about it and the young man bandaged him up and made him feel so much better...really great guy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed- overrated. :(”
Reviews.Author: Nat88888888
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read were so glowing, so the main problem for me was going there with my expectations so high. Also, the list of amenities is great, but I was expecting a little more than was delivered. Overall, the "pro" list is longer than the "con" list, but the main problem was the quality of the room. I think they need to lower their price a little bit, because the quality of rooms in chain hotels & motels with similar or lower prices are a lot better. I was kind of surprised at how old, dark, and run-down our room was. It had that strange mildew smell, and the shower water pressure was just drip-drip-drip, and it wasn't even draining. Yuck! We asked for a different room, and they said it wouldn't get any better unless we upgraded to a room with a kitchenette. We did, and to their credit, they gave us 15% off the new room, but it was still a bit old and run-down looking. At least in the second room, the bathroom worked better, it was not as dark & the smell was better. As for the amenities, they have a lot. Some of them are as promised, some of them are disappointing. We liked: The Pirate Sprayground The staff was nice & they did a good job planning out fun activities. Shuttle to the beach The in-house restaurant, Marlin Moon Grill- actually this place was awesome!! They give you a video camera to use for free while you're there, then they put your footage onto a DVD for you for free. We didn't visit the indoor pool, but at least it was a good option if it rained during our trip. The fact that they had a fitness center, even though the equipment was a little sparse and in disrepair. It's a nice amenity. The mini-golf was a little underwhelming, but at least it's there on the property, close by for an activity option. We didn't like: Breakfast (tiny juices, donuts from a box) The rooms

Reviews.Title: “This place is Wonderful..We all loved it !”
Reviews.Author: MarylandFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the Francis Scott Key.We loved it .It is great,especially for the kids.We will definetly be going back.Totally worth the money !

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun, not 5-star but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: bucsfans13
Reviews.Content: Other reviews pretty much cover everything well, so this will be to the point. We stayed 3 nights with two young kids. Our 8-yr old (who has been to WDW a number of times) called it "awesome". Great amenities for kids (sprayground, putt-putt, indoor pool) and conveniences for mom and dad (shuttle, breakfast). We stayed in the Maryland building, and like others we had that icky musty smell. The kids didn't care, so we dealt with it. Some of the buildings need some work on the paint, but other than that the place is decent. Kudos to them, they've obviously invested a lot in the things that everyone raves about. I'd bet they'll be addressing the upkeep items people have been posting. Bottom line - unbeatable value and the kids had a blast. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “what a blast”
Reviews.Author: dusty1201
Reviews.Content: my friend and i and a total of 6 kids(4 busy teens and an 8 yr old & 5 yr old stayed here for 3 days. What a blast. We barely could get them to leave the facility- so much to do. We loved the outlets across the street , and the chincoteaque ponies 8 miles away. Wow!! Shuttle was superconvenient. pools were endless fun. Rooms were clean-old -we stayed in the MD building-not 5 star but great for the price.Two suggestions- @ night it would be nice to have some ice cream while watching the kids at the mini golf, or have a convenience store right on the premises- this could be a money maker as well as a very useful ammenity. Thanks again for a great time had by all. the teens made alot of new friends, and the little ones were never bored.

Reviews.Title: “This will be a yearly trip from now on.”
Reviews.Author: tmdonovan74
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 5 night trip to FSK yesterday. It was our first vacation there but will definitely not be the last. We are already talking about staying longer next year. I have a 4 year old and a 13 year old and they both LOVED IT!!! We stayed in the Florida building and our kitchenette room was GREAT! Much cleaner than any other hotel I have ever stayed (even the high end hotels). Fatima wasour housekeeper and was so wonderful, even made a towel elephant for my 4 year old. I loved the temperapedic mattresses and anyone who complains must not know much about a good mattress. (I sold mattress' in the past.) The online pictures don't even do this place any justice. I was more than pleased with very aspect of our stay. I do agree that the rooms are a bit dark but that was my only complaint. My girlfriend and her 3 kids came for 2 days and she agreed that next year she will be staying much longer. Our kids, my mother and my husband all agreed that this is a great family resort where we all felt very safe. And if anyong is familiar with the cost of any decent hotel in Ocean City this is a STEAL!! Eventhough it a little less than a mile from the beach the shuttle was always accessible and was much easier than driving. The pirate sprayground was PERFECT b/c I got to lay and watch my kids play without the fear of drowing or being hurt. The indoor pool is so much more than a pool and both of my kids could have stayed in it all day. Also, we had appetizers at the very nice resturant located in the resort and the food was excellent and such a classy place for the adults to go. LOVED IT, LOVED IT, LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: irishbob77
Reviews.Content: Took the wife and kids to Ocean City for Mother's Day weekend and decided to stay at FSK Motel based on the positive family reviews. We had a great time! The indoor pool was really fun and actually saved the weekend since it was cold and rainy Friday and Saturday. We also had fun playing putt-putt and fishing in the little pond they have. Right across the street from a go-kart track and arcade which the kids loved and it was only a mile from the boardwalk. FSK had a really great family atmosphere. The only negative was that there was no microwave in the room. Everthing else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back This Summer!!! Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: maureen2009
Reviews.Content: We just returned Monday May 27, 2008 after spending the Memorial Day Weekend. We had the best time. The staff was great, the room was very clean and the beds are wonderful!! We had a full kitchen and were able to cook all of our meals in our rooom (big money savings). I took my 17 year old daughter, her boyfriend and my 6 year old son. There was something for everyone. My son loved the indoor pool and the putt putt golf. The older kids liked being so close to OC and going to the beach and the boardwalk. I wish I had known about this resort sooner. We will be going back next year for sure and maybe again this year for a long weekend. I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else. Next time I think we will rent one of the little houses, they looked really nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Grade School/Toddler Set”
Reviews.Author: LouMonika
Reviews.Content: Rooms are convenient with full kitchenette. Rooms are very clean -- nice beds. Rooms are a bit dark and carpet dated, but again very clean and newly renovated with light colored paneling and kitchenettes are both spotless and extremely convenient (full sized refrigerator, microwave, stove, etc). Best thing about this resort -- and it beats all other hotels in this at OC/DELMARVA beaches -- is the indoor kiddie pool outdoor pirate ship themed water play area -- not for the teen;preteen set -- but for the gradeschool/toddler set it's all new and simply the best at the beach (or just about anywhere else). Free minigolf and beach shuttle starting 6/1 too.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: cruisinocchic31
Reviews.Content: My husband and i also stay at the Francis Scott Key every May and Oct for cruisin. This is our 5th year and i would never even consider staying somewhere else. The staff at the front desk is wonderful, and the house keeping, they go above and beyond to make sure your room is clean.We have the same housekeeper every year Fatina. Never used the pool here but it does look very nice. The beds they have now are temper pedic WOW i am getting one of those for my house tlk about a good night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Lodging here for 10th Year!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenAdams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at FSK every year and this will be our 10th year. For the past 3 years, we've stayed here in May and October during the Ocean City Cruise Weekend. This is also our summer vacation destination where we bring our 9 year old daughter and one of her friends. The girls absolutely love the indoor pool! A few summers ago, it was so hot the entire week that we stayed (in July) that we only went out at night. Our saving grace was the indoor pool where the girls would spend the entire day! Without that, they would've had nothing to do! We've always had great service and the rooms are comfortable. The new beds are fantastic! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Only once did we have to switch a room due to smell. I believe it was in the Delaware (next to the new Pirate Ship). I think the problem is that behind that building was once a pool and there is direct access from each room. People most likely went in and out of the rooms while they were wet, thus the carpet has a mildew smell. I think this will probably continue w/ the Pirate Ship being so close. Maybe those rooms need tile instead of carpet (or at least in the entry area by the back door). The staff was very accomodating when we asked to move our room. I highly recommend FSK to all our friends and family. We will continue to make this our family vacation destination each year. I've been coming to OC since I was a kid. I want my daughter to have great OC memories like I did. But with the price of gas rising, it's hard to find an affordable place to stay these days. FSK offers affordability with a family resort atmosphere! Thank you to everyone at FSK for all your hard work and making our vacations so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: bethyah
Reviews.Content: My husband and 3 year old twin boys wanted to get away for a few days during spring break. We paid $79 each night for 2 nights, which isn't bad considering the prices on the ocean front. I had never stayed here before and I was looking for a hotel with a nice indoor "water park" for my kids. They enjoyed it. However, the hours were from noon until 8pm so we had nothing to do at night. Be aware that you do get what you pay for. The rooms do have a distinct smell to them, which most old Ocean City motels do! We went off season, so many of the usual places were closed. We didn't need to worry about the beach, so we decided to try this motel. If you are interested in the beach and do not want the usual beach smell at old motels, I would suggest save your money and stay at a newer resort hotel on the ocean. I would not pay in season rates during the summer to stay at this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kizjanadante
Reviews.Content: I took my family there for the spring fling deal they had. You basically get what you pay for. The rooms were very very old and smelled like mildew. The staff was very very rude. We were given one room which took our breathe as soon as we walked in. So we called to the front they gave us another room with air freshner. The best thing was the pool area which was small , butthe kids loved it. STAY AWAY!!! NOT WORTH THE GAS MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great time!”
Reviews.Author: mschenning
Reviews.Content: My husband, son (12) and myself stayed at the FSK the weekend of Oct 20th. We are no strangers to ocean city, as my parents live down there. We were looking for an inexpensive place with an indoor pool for my son and were pleasantly surprised with all the ammenites offered. Everyone was extremely nice and treated us respectfully. My son brought his bike and loved riding around the huge property, he would even ride up to the main building and get board games, movies, golf clubs, basketballs etc. I usually read the trip advisor reviews before booking any vacation, but for some reason I did not this time. Upon returning, i decided to read these reviews to see what others thought about the place and could not believe how many positive reviews there are. The negative reviews were all answered by the owner of the hotel which shows pride in her ownership of the facility. On Sunday, we checked out and decided to hang around Ocean City since it was a beautiful day, when finally getting ready to leave for home, my son begged for another day so they could go fishing one more time on stinky beach, we figured why not and pulled into the FSK for another night. Upon approaching the desk, the receptionist recognized us and responded "back already" and in a matter of seconds we were checked in again using our old paperwork which only took a few seconds. If you are looking for a great place to stay try their winter family package which gives you a $75.00 gift certificate for dinner, a $10.00 blockbuster video card and a $10.00 starbucks card.....how can you beat that deal. We are hoping to get down one more time this winter, and even giving up my parents "free" place this summer for a few days so my son can experience the pirate water spray area which was closed for the seaon....hey it was 80 degrees this weekend i wished they could have opened it! As others have mentioned, my only complaint was the lighting and no screens in the window so we could allow some fresh air in.

Reviews.Title: “FSK Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: ColonRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FSK for 2 nights 8/30-8/31/2007. We had been staying at the Commander for 4 nights (excellent place, check out other review), and planned to try FKS for 2 nights when friends met up with us. This is not a fancy place, but it worked out well and is great for kids. The value is unbeatable. We have a 21 month old and our friends have an 18 month old and they could have stayed at the pirate ship all day! They also loved the indoor pool and slide. The rooms could use a little updating, but they were fine. It would be nice if they had microwaves. One thing we noticed, they must have well water or really soft water because you get that feeling like your soap doesn't rinse off! It was nice to try a temperpedic mattress out because we had considered buying one, now we are glad we didn't. We weren't that impressed with them. We didn't use the shuttle because of wanting to use car seats, but I think it would be very convenient if you had older kids. The beach and boardwalk are very close and parking is not a problem at all. The outlet malls across the street are an extra bonus! The free breakfast is kind of lame, it would be nice if they had an area you could sit down and it took awhile for the staff to bring out more donuts because they went fast. This would be a great place to have a family reunion. We would stay here again if we were looking for a very affordable, family oriented vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family resort”
Reviews.Author: getzboo
Reviews.Content: My husband and two boys, ages 9 and 5, stayed at the FSK at the end of August with my sister's family of four (2 girls, also 9 and 5). What a fantastic place for kids and families! The outdoor spray ground is a riot, outdoor pool is great and has a poolside bar for adults and the indoor splash pool is warm, wonderful and fun. The indoor pool features "dive in movies" every night at 8. We didn't get a chance to play miniature golf, because our stay was only 3 days, but free passes were included with your reservation. The location of the motel is ideal, right across the street from an outlet mall, next door to a Starbucks and huge beach store and only a 2 minute drive to the Ocean City boardwalk and beaches. The motel also offers free shuttle service from 10 am to 10 pm about every 15-20 minutes for guests. The on-site restaurant was casual enough for beachgoers, but still had an upscale feel and menu. Our older son is handicapped and the staff was very friendly and accomodating when we dined there. There is a grab and go breakfast every morning featuring coffee, donuts, fruit and juice. I just can't say enough about this place. Rooms were clean and comfortable (our room featured a tempurpedic mattress) with plenty of pillows, an ironing board, minifridge and coffee maker. The ONLY suggestion I would make is that the bathrooms need a vanity or some flat surface where toiletries can be laid out. Great value too ($70-90/night)!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the price or the indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: Famwidkidz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the FSK. Our kids loved the pools (the splash pool, outside pool, and the inside carribean pool). The inside pool is very unique and the reason we stayed here. The drive to the beach is .9 miles. Not too bad. They have a shuttle but it stopped after Labor Day. The rooms were satisfactory. The staff was friendly. I would echo the comments that the rooms were dark and needed better lighting. We arrived Labor Day weekend and the place was packed. The place cleared out the Tuesday after Labor Day, and we had the place almost to ourselves. On Thursday, the bikes rolled in -a bike rally group that came in a week before bike week. Thankfully, the bikers were not rowdy, but motorcyles (lots of them), in and of themselves, were loud and we have young kids. I would check to see if they are renting out the place to an entire group before renting. Otherwise, if you have a young family, check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Yay for the FSK!”
Reviews.Author: my3guys
Reviews.Content: For the past several years we have been staying at another OC property on the beach. This year we decided to try out Francis Scott Key Family Resort, and I'm so glad we did! After a quick check-in, we went to our room were very happy. It was clean (of #1 importance to us), well maintained, and had great amenities. The lighting was dim, as many have mentioned, but we opened our window to let in some light. The location is great--close to shopping, restaurants, Starbucks!, and far from the noise of the beach. When we did go to the beach, we drove our car, only because we have a lot of stuff. But we did use the shuttle to go to the Boardwalk one evening for dinner and to visit the amusement park. The driver was friendly and the shuttle was clean. There is so much to do at FSK! The reason we chose to stay here is because it was Labor Day weekend and I was afraid the weather would not be as warm and I wanted an indoor pool. Well, this indoor pool was exactly what I was hoping for, not some small, uninviting, run-of-the-mill indoor pool at the chain hotels. The water was warm, our 6-year-old loved the slide, our toddler had a blast with the whale in the baby pool area, and the entire place was clean. The best part was that there was a family movie each night on the screen above the pool. Although it was a bit hard to hear, the subtitles helped out. There is also a mini-golf course next to the outdoor pool, an outdoor water play area, volleyball net, playground, and picnic area. The free breakfast was minimal--bananas, mini muffins, donuts, coffee, and juice--but hey, it's free. Since our room had a microwave and refrigerator (a nice sized one, not the college dorm type), we went to the grocery store around the corner and bought some breakfast meats to supplement the free breakfast. Overall, we had a wonderful time. We're already making plans to return next summer. And the weather did end up being perfect! (A last note to management: a screen in the window and a curved shower curtain rod in the bathroom would be a nice touch).

HotelInfo.Name: Francis Scott Key Family Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 12806 Ocean Gateway, Ocean City, MD 21842
